TEXT.English: [H1]Ablai Khan[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kazakh Khan of the Middle Juz[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] 1711 - 1781 [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Born as Abilmansur, Ablai Khan belonged to the senior branch of descendants of the 15th century founder of the Kazakh state, Janybek Khan. In the first half of the 18th century, Ablai Khan proved to be a talented organizer and commander as he headed detachments of the Kazakh militia fighting the Dzungars. He participated in the most significant battles against the Dzungars from the 1720s to the 1750s, for which he was declared a "batyr" ("hero") by the people.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ablai's activity aimed to create a strong and independent Kazakh state. He headed the unified forces of the Kazakhs and furthered the centralization of state power in Kazakhstan. Until his election as the khan of the three jüzes, Ablai had to compete with Khan Abul Mambet and his descendants of Middle jüz for leadership. Initially, Russia recognized Abul Mambet as the Khan of Middle jüz, while Ablai was supported by China. Ablai's talent in playing China against Russia gradually made him the unrivalled Khan of the steppe. Unlike Abul Khair Khan of Little jüz, Ablai never submitted to Russian rule. In 1771, at the meeting of the representatives of the three jüzes, Ablai was elected as the Kazakh khan. Russian Empress requested that the title of khan should be recognized and officially approved by Russia. To that end, she sent an official letter to Petropavl, where Ablai was expected to receive the title in 1779. He never showed up at the fort, declining Russia's request to appoint him as the khan of Middle jüz. In contrast to Ablai, other khans and sultans had been competing for the lavish gifts and stipends of the Emperors of Russia in return for their submission.[PARAGRAPH:1]During the Qing campaigns against the Dzungars, Ablai Khan chose not to take sides in the Dzungar-Chinese conflict. Once the conflict was settled, Ablai offered his submission to the Qianlong Emperor. Ablai was confirmed as Kazakh khan by both the Chinese and the Russians. He lead numerous campaigns against Kokand Khanate and Kyrgyzs. In the last campaign his troops liberated many cities in Southern Kazakhstan and even captured Tashkent. Then he procedeed to present day Kyrgyzstan and won the furious battle with troops of local warlords. Upon his death in 1781 he was interred in the Mausoleum of Khoja Ahmed Yasavi in Hazrat-e Turkestan.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Ablai Khan[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kazakh Khan de la Jüz Mediana[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] 1711 - 1781 [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Antecedentes:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Nacido como Abilmansur, Ablai Khan pertenecía a la rama mayor de los descendientes del fundador del siglo 15 del Estado de Kazajstán, Janybek Khan. En la primera mitad del siglo 18, Ablai Khan demostró ser un organizador talentoso y comandante mientras dirigía destacamentos de la milicia kazajo contra los Dzungars. Participó en las batallas más importantes contra el Dzungars desde la década de 1720 a la década de 1750, por el que fue declarado "Batyr" ("héroe") por el pueblo[PARAGRAPH:1]Ablai pretendía crear un estado kazajo fuerte e independiente. Se dirigió a las fuerzas unificadas de los kazajos y fomentó la centralización del poder del Estado en Kazajstán. Hasta su elección como el khan de los tres jüzes, Ablai tuvo que competir con Khan Abul Mambet y sus descendientes de Jüz Mediana para el liderazgo. Inicialmente, Rusia reconoció Abul Mambet como el Khan de la Jüz Mediana, mientras Ablai recibió el apoyo de China. El talento de Ablai en jugar de China contra Rusia lo hizo gradualmente el inigualable Khan de la estepa. A diferencia de Abul Khair Khan de la Jüz Menor, Ablai nunca se presentó al gobierno ruso. En 1771, en la reunión de los representantes de los tres Jüzes, Ablai fue elegido como el Kazakh khan. La Emperatriz Rusa pidió que el título de Khan debe ser reconocido y oficialmente aprobado por Rusia. Para ello, envió una carta oficial a Petropavl, donde Ablai esperaba recibir el título en 1779. Él nunca apareció en el fuerte, la declinacion de la solicitud de Rusia para designarlo como el khan de Jüz Mediana. En contraste con Ablai, otros kanes y sultanes habían estado compitiendo por los regalos de lujo y estipendios de los emperadores de Rusia a cambio de su sumisión.[PARAGRAPH:1]Durante las campañas de los Qing contra Dzungars, Ablai Khan decidió no tomar partido en el conflicto Dzungar-chino. Una vez que el conflicto se resolvió, Ablai ofreció su sumisión al emperador Qianlong. Ablai fue confirmado como Kazakh khan tanto por los chinos y los rusos. Él condujo numerosas campañas contra Kokand Khanate y Kyrgyzs. En la última campaña sus tropas liberaron muchas ciudades en el sur de Kazajstán e incluso capturaron Tashkent. Luego se procedió a presentar día Kyrgyzstan y ganó la batalla furiosa con las tropas de los caudillos locales. A su muerte en 1781 fue enterrado en el Mausoleo de Khoja Ahmed Yasawi en Hazrat-e Turquestán.

TEXT.English: [H1]Agamemnon[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prince of Mycenae[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH: 1][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Agamemnon's father, Atreus, the king of Mycenae, was murdered by Aegistheus and his wife. The two took possession of the thrown of Mycenae, and so Agamemnon and his brother, Menelaus, went to the king of Sparta. There, Agamemnon married Clytemnestra, the daughter of Tyndareus, king of Sparta, and had five children.[PARAGRAPH: 1]Agamemnon is known for his role in the Trojan War. Much of Agamemnon's life is encompassed by myth, so some of the information about the Trojan War is unreliable. Agamemnon gathered Greek soldiers to sail for Troy. Agamemnon was the Commander-in-Chief for the Greek Army, and had slain many important people from the Trojan Army. He killed Antiphus, and Helaesus. After the war, Cassandra, daughter of Priam, was given to Agamemnon as a prize.[PARAGRAPH: 1]Agamemnon returned to Greece with Cassandra and landed in Argolis. Agamemnon's wife Clytemnestra had taken a lover, Aegistheus, and invited Agamemnon to a banquet. There, Agamemnon was slain and died. Clytemnestra then ruled Agamemnon's kingdom for a time, but the murder of Agamemnon was eventually avenged by his son Orestes with the help of his daughter Electra.
TEXT.French: [H1]Agamemnon[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prince de Mycènes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH: 1][BOLD]Fond:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Le père d'Agamemnon, Atreus, roi de Mycenae, a été assassiné par Aegistheus et son épouse. Les deux ont pris la possession du jetée de Mycenae, et ainsi Agamemnon et son frère, Menelaus, sont allés au roi de Sparta. Là, Clytemnestra marié par Agamemnon, la fille de Tyndareus, roi de Sparta, et a eu cinq enfants. [PARAGRAPH : 2] Agamemnon est connu pour son rôle dans la guerre de Trojan. Beaucoup de la vie d'Agamemnon est entourée par mythe, ainsi certaines d'informations sur la guerre de Trojan sont incertaines. Agamemnon a recueilli les soldats grecs pour naviguer pour Troie. Agamemnon était le Commander-in-Chief pour l'armée grecque, et avait massacré beaucoup de personnes importantes de l'armée de Trojan. Il a tué Antiphus, et Helaesus. Après la guerre, Cassandra, fille de Priam, a été donné à Agamemnon comme prix. [PARAGRAPH : 3] Agamemnon retourné en Grèce avec Cassandra et débarqué dans Argolis. L'épouse Clytemnestra d'Agamemnon avait pris un amoureux, un Aegistheus, et un Agamemnon invité à un banquet. Là, Agamemnon a été massacré et mort. Clytemnestra a alors régné le royaume d'Agamemnon pendant un certain temps, mais le meurtre d'Agamemnon a été par la suite vengé par son fils Orestes avec l'aide de sa fille Electra.
TEXT.German: [H1]Agamenon[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prinz von Mykene[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH: 1][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Vater Agamemnons, Atreus, der König von Mycenae, wurde von Aegistheus und von seiner Frau ermordet. Die zwei nahmen den Besitz von geworfen von Mycenae und also gingen Agamemnon und sein Bruder, Menelaus, zum König von Sparta. Dort hatte Agamemnon verbundenes Clytemnestra, die Tochter von Tyndareus, König von Sparta und fünf Kinder. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Agamemnon bekannt für seine Rolle im Trojan Krieg. Viel von Leben Agamemnons wird durch Mythus umgegeben, also ist etwas von den Informationen über den Trojan Krieg unzuverlässig. Agamemnon erfaßte griechische Soldaten, um für Troy zu segeln. Agamemnon war der Commander-in-Chief für die griechische Armee und hatte viele wichtige Leute von der Trojan Armee getötet. Er tötete Antiphus und Helaesus. Nach dem Krieg Agamemnon wurde Cassandra, Tochter von Priam, als Preis gegeben. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Agamemnon zurückgebracht nach Griechenland mit Cassandra und in Argolis gelandet. Frau Clytemnestra Agamemnons hatte einen Geliebten, ein Aegistheus und ein eingeladenes Agamemnon zu einem Bankett genommen. Dort wurde Agamemnon getötet und gestorben. Clytemnestra ordnete dann Königreich Agamemnons während einer Zeit an, aber der Mord an Agamemnon avenged schließlich von seinem Sohn Orestes mit Hilfe seiner Tochter Electra.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Agamennone[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Principe di Micene[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH: 1][BOLD]Priorità bassa:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Il padre del Agamemnon, Atreus, il re di Mycenae, è stato assassinato da Aegistheus e dalla sua moglie. I due hanno preso il possesso del gettato di Mycenae ed in modo da Agamemnon ed il suo fratello, Menelaus, sono andato al re di Sparta. Là, Clytemnestra sposato Agamemnon, la figlia di Tyndareus, re di Sparta ed ha avuto cinque bambini. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Agamemnon è conosciuto per il suo ruolo nella guerra di Trojan. Molta di vita del Agamemnon è compresa dal mito, in modo da alcune delle informazioni sulla guerra di Trojan sono non fidate. Agamemnon ha riunito i soldati greci per navigare per Troy. Agamemnon era il Commander-in-Chief per l'esercito greco e slain molta gente importante dall'esercito del Trojan. Ha ucciso Antiphus e Helaesus. Dopo la guerra, Cassandra, figlia di Priam, è stato dato a Agamemnon come premio. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Agamemnon restituito in Grecia con Cassandra ed atterrato in Argolis. La moglie Clytemnestra del Agamemnon aveva preso un amante, un Aegistheus e un Agamemnon invitato ad un banquet. Là, Agamemnon slain e morto stato. Clytemnestra allora ha regolato il regno del Agamemnon per un certo tempo, ma l'omicidio di Agamemnon finalmente avenged dal suo figlio Orestes con l'aiuto della sua figlia Electra.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Agamenón[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Príncipe de Micenas[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH: 1][BOLD]Fondo:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]A su esposa asesinó al padre de Agamemnon, Atreus, el rey de Mycenae, Aegistheus y. Los dos tomaron la posesión del lanzada de Mycenae, y así que Agamemnon y su hermano, Menelaus, fueron al rey de Sparta. Allí, Clytemnestra casado Agamemnon, la hija de Tyndareus, rey de Sparta, y tenía cinco niños. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Agamemnon se conoce para su papel en la guerra de Trojan. Mucha de la vida de Agamemnon es abarcada por mito, así que algo de la información sobre la guerra de Trojan es no fiable. Agamemnon recolectó a soldados griegos para navegar para Troy. Agamemnon era el comandante en jefe para el ejército griego, y había matado a mucha gente importante del ejército de Trojan. Él mató a Antiphus, y a Helaesus. Después de la guerra, dieron Cassandra, hija de Priam, a Agamemnon como premio. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Agamemnon vuelto a Grecia con Cassandra y aterrizado en Argolis. La esposa Clytemnestra de Agamemnon había llevado un amante, un Aegistheus, y un Agamemnon invitado un banquete. Allí, Agamemnon fue matado y muerto. Clytemnestra entonces gobernó el reino de Agamemnon por una época, pero el asesinato de Agamemnon fue vengado eventual por su hijo Orestes con la ayuda de su hija Electra.

TEXT.English: [H1]Mahmoud Ahmadinejad[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Iran[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]1956 - [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Mahmoud Ahmadinejad became president after winning the 2005 presidential election by popular vote. Prior to becoming president, Ahmadinejad served as mayor of Tehran, a governor of Kurdistan, Ardabil, and served in the Iran-Iraq War, as a member of Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution. He is the highest directly elected official in the country; constitutionally, he has much less power than the Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who is the commander-in-chief of the armed forces of Iran and has the final word in all aspects of foreign and domestic policies.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ahmadinejad is a critic of the George W. Bush Administration and supports strengthened relations with Russia, Venezuela, Syria, and the Persian Gulf states. He has said Iran's nuclear program is for peaceful purposes and has refused to end enrichment despite United Nations Security Council resolutions.[PARAGRAPH:1]He has called for the dissolution of the state of Israel and its government, which he does not regard as legitimate or representative of the population,and for free elections in the region. He believes that the Palestinians need a stronger voice in the region's future. One of his most controversial statements was one in which, according to some translations, he called for Israel to be "wiped off the map," but interpretations of this statement vary widely. He has also been condemned for describing the Holocaust as a myth, which has led to accusations of anti-semitism. In response to these criticisms, Ahmadinejad said, "No, I am not anti-Jew, I respect them very much."[PARAGRAPH:1]During his presidency, Ahmadinejad launched a gas rationing plan to reduce the country's fuel consumption and cut the interest rate for private and public banking facilities.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Mahmoud Ahmadinejad[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Presidente de Irán[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vivio: [\BOLD]1956 - [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Antecedentes:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, llegó a la presidencia tras ganar las elecciones presidenciales de 2005 por el voto popular. Antes de convertirse en presidente, Ahmadinejad se desempeñó como alcalde de Tehran, un gobernador del Kurdistan, Ardabil, y sirvió en la guerra entre Irán e Irak, como miembro de Cuerpos de la Guardia Revolucionaria Islámica. Él es el más alto funcionario de elección directa en el país; constitucionalmente, tiene mucho menos poder que el líder supremo, el Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, quien es el comandante en jefe de las fuerzas armadas de Irán y tiene la última palabra en todos los aspectos de la política exterior e interior. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ahmadinejad es un crítico de la administración de George W. Bush y apoya fortalecimiento de las relaciones con Rusia, Venezuela, Siria y los países del Golfo Pérsico. Dijo que el programa nuclear de Irán es para fines pacíficos y ha negado enriquecimiento extremo a pesar de las resoluciones del Consejo de Seguridad de las Naciones Unidas. [PARAGRAPH:1]Él ha pedido la disolución del Estado de Israel y su gobierno, que no considera como legítimo o representativa de la población, y por elecciones libres en la región. Él cree que los palestinos necesitan una voz más fuerte en el futuro de la región. Una de sus declaraciones más controvertidas fue una en la que, según algunas traducciones, pidió que Israel sea "borrado del mapa", pero la interpretación de esta declaración puede variar ampliamente. También ha sido condenado por describir el Holocausto como un mito, lo que ha llevado a acusaciones de antisemitismo. En respuesta a estas críticas, dijo Ahmadinejad, "No, yo no soy anti-Judio, los respeto mucho." [PARAGRAPH:1] Durante su presidencia, Ahmadinejad lanzó un plan de racionamiento de gas para reducir el consumo de combustible del país y reducir la tasa de interés para los servicios bancarios privados y públicos.

TEXT.English: [H1]Ajatashatru[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Magadha Empire[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] c.491-461 BC [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Ajatashatru was a king of the Magadha empire that ruled north India. There is not a great deal known about Ajatashatru. What is known is that he became a King of Magadha and the adjoining areas by murdering his father, Seniya/Bimbisara. Also, he was a contemporary of Buddha, was a patron of the then-new religion of Buddhism, and he let the Sangha function in his Kingdom.[PARAGRAPH:1]Some details of his life are given in the earliest Buddhist scriptures of the Pali Canon. In the Samaññaphala Sutta, Gautama Buddha said that if Ajatasattu hadn't killed his father, he would have attained sotapannahood, a degree of enlightenment. But because he had killed his father he could not attain it.[PARAGRAPH:1]According to Romila Thapar, Ajatashatru was responsible for building Pataliputra and strengthening the defences of the Magadhan capital, Rajagriha. The same historian reports that Ajatashatru murdered his father and predecessor Bimbisara in order to accede to the throne. This is also recorded in the Buddhist scripture, the Contemplation Sutra. Next, Ajatashatru, undertook the annexation of the kingdoms of Kosala and Kashi, and pursued a sixteen-year war against the Vriji confederacy of north Bihar and Nepal. Legends say that the one who masterminded Ajatashatru's usurping of the throne was the schismatic monk Devadatta, the reasons being that Ajatashatru was said to have been convinced by Devadatta to help fund his schismatic sangha.

[H1]Alaksandu[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alaksandu was a king of Wilusa who sealed a treaty with Muwatalli II ca. 1280 BC. This treaty implies that Alaksandu had previously secured a treaty with Muwatalli's father, Mursili II, as well. Alaksandu was a successor of one Kukkunni, although it is not known if he was his immediate successor. Muwatalli recalls the friendship of Kukkunni with his own grandfather, Suppiluliuma I, and further evokes over three centuries of friendship between the Hittites and Wilusa dating back to the reign of Hattusili I. Muwatalli in his letter downplays the importance of royal ancestry, suggesting that Alaksandu had come to power by other means than regular succession, so that Alaksandu is not necessarily a blood-relation of Kukkunni's. This has been taken as a hint that he may have been an early Greek ruler called Alexander, and he has been associated with Homer's Alexandros of Ilion, who is better known by his nickname Paris, of Troy. One of three gods guaranteeing the terms of the treaty on the side of Alaksandu is Apaliunas, from whom Apollon apparently derived. The god Apollo is portrayed in the Iliad as the foremost champion of the Trojans and the one who helped Paris kill the otherwise invulnerable Achilles.

[H1]Alaric I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Visigoths[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] c.370 - 410 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]After serving in the campaigns of Emperor Theodosius I against the western usurper Eugenius in 394, the Visigothic chieftain Alaric revolted, displeased because he had not received sufficient reward. Between 395 and 397, he led the Visigoths in devastating Thrace and Greece, sacking several cities including Corinth and Sparta. He invaded Italy in 401 and besieged the Western Roman emperor Flavius Honorius (395-423) in Milan. In 402, after being defeated at Pollentia and Verona by the Western Empire general Stilicho, he moved into the province of Noricum, just north of Italy.[PARAGRAPH:1]Following Stilicho's murder in 408, Alaric invaded Italy after Honorius refused to pay him for past services. A siege of Rome was alternately lifted and renewed. Finally, on August 24, 410, after being joined by his relative Athaulf, Alaric captured Rome. The city was sacked for three days; churches were generally left untouched. The damage was more psychological than material. For the first time in 800 years, Rome had fallen. No longer could it be called "Unconquered Rome."[PARAGRAPH:1]Alaric then traveled south, hoping to cross to Sicily, but after the Gothic fleet was wrecked, he turned back north. On this journey, he became ill and died at Cosentia in southern Italy.[PARAGRAPH:1]It is said that Alaric was buried with his treasures in the bed of the Busento River, which was temporarily diverted from its course. That the secret of his burial place might be kept, the slaves employed in the labor were killed.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[H1]Alboin[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Langobards[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]? - 572[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alboin was born to Audoin and his wife Rodelinda. After Audoin died, Alboin, the tenth king entered the government of his country. He followed the wishes of his people. Around the same time, Turisund, king of the Gepids, died. Therefore, his son Cunimund succeeded to the throne. Although the Gepids had already had a peace treaty with the Langobards, Cunimund broke this treaty. At this same time, Alboin had made an everlasting treaty with the Avars. Despite all this, Cunimund continued to force his people to fight. Cunimund announced that if his people were able to overcome the Langobards, then they would attack the Avars, who now occupied the lands of the Gepids. Under the leadership of Alboin, the Langobards were victorious. The Langobards had such a powerful military that they reduced the Gepids to utter destruction. Alboin killed Cunimund and made a goblet out of his skeleton, known as a scala. [PARAGRAPH: 1] The success of Alboin had spread so far, that word of his powerful military had spread to Rome. Rome sought out the help of Alboin and the Langobards in their war against the Goths. The Langobards were transported to Rome by way of the sea. Much to the hope of the Romans, Alboin had reduced the king of the Goths, Totila, to a state of destruction. The Langobards returned to their country bearing gifts and riches. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Alboin, after all his military success, now set out for Italy. He asked for help from the Saxons who in turn supplied him with 20,000 men to proceed to Italy. Alboin hoped to lead his people in a migration to Italy. He then gave Pannonia, the current home of the Langobards, to the Huns. The only conditions were that if the Langobards were to ever return, they would be able to take possession of Pannonia immediately. Alboin first entered Venetia. Alboin declared that his nephew Gisulf would be the duke once conquered. Gisulf demanded that Alboin give him any Langobard people of his choice before becoming duke. Alboin agreed to this condition. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Alboin came to the river Piave first. The bishop of the church of Tarvisium, Felix, asked the king to grant him the church after the land was conquered. Alboin was gracious and granted his request. Alboin then went on to capture the cities of Vicenza, Verona, and the remaining cities of Venetia. He captured all the cities but Padua, Monselice, and Mantua. After conquering Venetia, Alboin moved his army to Liguria. He took all the cities of Liguria except those situated on the shores. The city of Pavia was one of the hardest cities to take. It lasted three years and some months to surrender to Alboin after being besieged. Alboin took possession of everything as far as Tuscany except Rome, Ravenna, and some other fortified places. [PARAGRAPH: 1] The Romans were so devastated by this loss and the disease that occurred. Alboin had vowed to put all the people of these conquered cities to death. However, Alboin was a good man. Alboin broke this vow and allowed the people to live without injury. Alboin ruled Italy for three and a half years before being assassinated by his wife.
TEXT.French: [H1]Alboin[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Roi d'Langobardia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Dates :[\BOLD]? - 572[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Biographie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alboin a été soutenu à Audoin et à son épouse Rodelinda. Après qu'Audoin soit mort, Alboin, le dixième roi a écrit le gouvernement de son pays. Il a suivi les souhaits de ses personnes. Autour du même temps, Turisund, roi du Gepids, est mort. Par conséquent, son fils Cunimund a hérité du jeté. Bien que le Gepids ait déjà eu un traité de paix avec le Langobards, Cunimund a cassé ce traité. À ce même temps, Alboin avait fait un traité éternel avec l'Avars. En dépit du tout ceci, Cunimund a continué à forcer ses personnes à combattre. Cunimund a annoncé que si ses personnes pouvaient surmonter le Langobards, alors elles attaqueraient l'Avars, qui a maintenant occupé les terres du Gepids. Sous la conduite d'Alboin, le Langobards étaient victorieux. Le Langobards a eu des militaires si puissants qu'ils ont ramené le Gepids à la destruction totale. Cunimund tué par Alboin et fait un gobelet hors de son squelettique, connu comme scala. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] Le succès d'Alboin avait écarté jusqu'ici, ce mot de ses militaires puissants s'était écarté à Rome. Rome a cherché l'aide d'Alboin et du Langobards dans leur guerre contre le Goths. Le Langobards ont été transportés à Rome par la mer. Beaucoup à l'espoir du Romans, Alboin avait ramené le roi du Goths, Totila, à un état de destruction. Le Langobards est revenu à leurs cadeaux et richesse de roulement de pays. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] Alboin, après tout son succès militaire, a maintenant visé pour l'Italie. Il a demandé l'aide du Saxons qui l'a à leur tour fourni 20.000 hommes pour procéder en Italie. Alboin a espéré mener ses personnes dans une migration en Italie. Il a alors donné Pannonia, la maison courante du Langobards, aux huns. Les seules conditions étaient que si le Langobards étaient de retourner jamais, elles pourraient prendre la possession de Pannonia immédiatement. Alboin est entré dans la première fois Venetia. Alboin a déclaré que son neveu Gisulf serait le duc une fois conquis. Gisulf a exigé qu'Alboin lui donnent n'importe quel Langobard les gens de son choix avant duc devenant. Alboin était d'accord sur cette condition. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] Alboin est venu au fleuve Piave d'abord. L'évêque de l'église de Tarvisium, Felix, a demandé au roi de lui accorder l'église après que la terre ait été conquise. Alboin était aimable et a accordé sa demande. Alboin a alors continué pour capturer les villes de Vicence, de Vérone, et des villes restantes de Venetia. Il a capturé toutes villes par Padoue, Monselice, et Mantua. Après conquête de Venetia, Alboin a déplacé son armée en Ligurie. Il a pris toutes villes de la Ligurie excepté ceux situées sur les rivages. La ville de Pavie était l'une des villes les plus dures à prendre. Elle a duré trois ans et quelques mois pour se rendre à Alboin après avoir été assiégé. Alboin a pris la possession de tout jusque la Toscane excepté Rome, Ravenne, et quelques autres endroits enrichis. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] Le Romans étaient ainsi dévasté par cette perte et la maladie qui se sont produites. Alboin s'était voué à mettre toutes personnes de ces villes conquises à la mort. Cependant, Alboin était un bon homme. Alboin a cassé ce voeu et a permis au peuple de vivre sans dommages. Alboin a régné l'Italie pour trois et une moitié d'années avant d'être assassiné par son épouse.
TEXT.German: [H1]Alboin[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]König von Langobardia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lebte: [\BOLD]? - 572[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alboin wurde zu Audoin und zu seiner Frau Rodelinda getragen. Nachdem Audoin starb, trug Alboin, der zehnte König die Regierung seines Landes ein. Er folgte den Wünschen seiner Leute. Um die gleiche Zeit starb Turisund, König des Gepids. Folglich folgte sein Sohn Cunimund zu geworfen. Obgleich das Gepids bereits einen Friedensvertrag mit dem Langobards gehabt hatte, brach Cunimund diesen Vertrag. Zu dieser gleichen Zeit hatte Alboin einen ewig Vertrag mit dem Avars gebildet. Trotz alles fuhr dieses, Cunimund fort, seine Leute zu zwingen zu kämpfen. Cunimund verkündete daß, wenn seine Leute in der Lage waren, das Langobards zu überwinden, dann würden sie das Avars in Angriff nehmen, das jetzt die Länder des Gepids besetzte. Unter der Führung von Alboin, waren das Langobards siegreich. Das Langobards hatte solch ein leistungsfähiges Militär, daß sie das Gepids verringerten, um Zerstörung zu äußern. Alboin getötetes Cunimund und gebildet einen Becher aus seinem skeleton heraus, bekannt als scala. [PUNKT: 1] Der Erfolg von Alboin hatte bis jetzt, dieses Wort seines leistungsfähigen Militärs hatte verbreitet nach Rom verbreitet. Rom suchte die Hilfe von Alboin und von Langobards in ihrem Krieg gegen das Goths aus. Das Langobards wurden nach Rom über das Meer transportiert. Viel zur Hoffnung des Romans, Alboin hatte den König des Goths, Totila, auf einem Zustand der Zerstörung verringert. Das Langobards ging zu ihren Landlager Geschenken und riches zurück. [PUNKT: 1] Alboin, nach seinem ganzem militärischen Erfolg, legte jetzt für Italien dar. Er bat um Hilfe vom Saxons, das ihn der Reihe nach mit 20.000 Männern lieferte, um nach Italien fortzufahren. Alboin hoffte, seine Leute in einer Migration nach Italien zu führen. Er gab den Hunnen dann Pannonia, das gegenwärtige Haus des Langobards. Die einzigen Bedingungen waren, daß, wenn das Langobards, überhaupt zurückzugehen waren, sie nehmen Besitz von Pannonia sofort wurden. Alboin kam zuerst Venetia. Alboin erklärte, daß sein Neffe Gisulf der einmal eroberte Herzog sein würde. Gisulf verlangte, daß Alboin ihm jeden möglichen Langobard Leute seiner Wahl vor werdenem Herzog geben. Alboin stimmte dieser Bedingung zu. [PUNKT: 1] Alboin kam zum Fluß Piave zuerst. Der Bishop der Kirche von Tarvisium, Felix, bat den König, ihm die Kirche zu bewilligen, nachdem das Land erobert wurde. Alboin war liebenswürdig und bewilligte seinen Antrag. Alboin fuhr dann fort, die Städte von Vicenza, von Verona und von restlichen Städte von Venetia gefangenzunehmen. Er nahm alle Städte durch Padua, Monselice und Mantua gefangen. Nachdem er Venetia erobert hatte, verschob Alboin seine Armee nach Ligurien. Er nahm alle Städte von Ligurien ausgenommen die aufgestellt auf den Ufern. Die Stadt von Pavia war eine der härtesten Städte, zum zu nehmen. Sie dauerte drei Jahre und einige Monate, um Alboin zu übergeben, nachdem sie belagert worden waren. Alboin nahm Besitz von alles bis zu Toskana ausgenommen Rom, Ravenna und einige andere verstärkte Plätze. [PUNKT: 1] Das Romans waren also verwüstet durch diesen Verlust und die Krankheit, die auftraten. Alboin hatte geschworen, um alle Leute dieser eroberten Städte zum Tod zu setzen. Jedoch war Alboin ein guter Mann. Alboin brach dieses schwören und erlaubten den Leuten, ohne Verletzung zu leben. Alboin ordnete Italien für drei und eine Hälfte Jahr an, bevor er von seiner Frau ermordet wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Alboino[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Re di Langobardia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vita: [\BOLD]? - 572[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alboin è stato sopportato a Audoin ed alla sua moglie Rodelinda. Dopo che Audoin muoia, Alboin, il decimo re ha fornito il governo del suo paese. Ha seguito i desideri della sua gente. Intorno allo stesso tempo, Turisund, re del Gepids, è morto. Di conseguenza, il suo figlio Cunimund è riuscito al gettato. Anche se il Gepids già aveva avuto un trattato di pace con il Langobards, Cunimund ha rotto questo trattato. A questo stesso tempo, Alboin aveva fatto un trattato everlasting con il Avars. Malgrado il tutto questo, Cunimund ha continuato a forzare la sua gente combattere. Cunimund ha annunciato che se la sua gente potesse sormontare il Langobards, quindi attaccherebbero il Avars, che ora ha occupato le terre del Gepids. Sotto la direzione di Alboin, il Langobards era victorious. Il Langobards ha avuto così militari potenti che hanno ridotto il Gepids a distruzione assoluta. Cunimund ucciso Alboin e reso ad un calice dal suo di scheletro, conosciuto come scala. [PARAGRAFO: 1] Il successo di Alboin si era sparso finora, quella parola dei suoi militari potenti si era sparso a Roma. Roma ha cercato l'aiuto di Alboin e del Langobards nella loro guerra contro il Goths. Il Langobards è stato trasportato a Roma via il mare. Molto alla speranza del Romans, Alboin aveva ridotto il re del Goths, Totila, ad un dichiarare di distruzione. Il Langobards ha rinviato ai loro regali e riches del cuscinetto del paese. [PARAGRAFO: 1] Alboin, dopo tutto il suo successo militare, ora ha precisato per l'Italia. Ha chiesto aiuto dal Saxons che a loro volta gli ha fornito 20.000 uomini per continuare in Italia. Alboin ha sperato di condurre la sua gente in un'espansione in Italia. Allora ha dato Pannonia, la sede corrente del Langobards, ai Huns. Le uniche circostanze erano che se il Langobards fosse di rinviare mai, potrebbero prendere immediatamente il possesso di Pannonia. Alboin in primo luogo ha entrato in Venetia. Alboin ha dichiarato che il suo nipote Gisulf sarebbe il duca conquistato una volta. Gisulf ha richiesto che Alboin gli dà tutto il Langobard la gente della sua scelta prima del duca diventante. Alboin ha accosentito a questa circostanza. [PARAGRAFO: 1] Alboin è venuto al fiume Piave in primo luogo. Il bishop della chiesa di Tarvisium, Felix, ha chiesto al re di assegnargli la chiesa dopo che la terra fosse conquistata. Alboin era gracious ed ha assegnato la sua richiesta. Alboin allora ha continuato a bloccare le città di Vicenza, di Verona e delle città restanti di Venetia. Ha bloccato tutte le città da Padova, da Monselice e da Mantua. Dopo la conquista del Venetia, Alboin ha spostato il suo esercito in Liguria. Ha preso tutte le città della Liguria tranne quelle situate sui puntelli. La città di Pavia era una delle città più dure da prendere. Ha durato tre anni e determinati mesi per cedere a Alboin dopo besieged. Alboin ha preso il possesso di tutto fino alla Toscana tranne Roma, Ravenna ed alcuni altri posti fortificati. [PARAGRAFO: 1] Il Romans era in modo da devastante da questa perdita e dalla malattia che hanno accaduto. Alboin aveva fatto voto in mettere tutta la gente di queste città conquistate alla morte. Tuttavia, Alboin era un buon uomo. Alboin ha rotto questo voto e che ha permesso che la gente vivesse senza ferita. Alboin ha regolato l'Italia per tre e una metà di anni prima di essere assassinato dalla sua moglie.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Alboino[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rey de Langobardia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vivió: [\BOLD]? - 572[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alboin fue llevado a Audoin y a su esposa Rodelinda. Después de que Audoin muriera, Alboin, el décimo rey incorporó el gobierno de su país. Él siguió los deseos de su gente. Alrededor del mismo tiempo, Turisund, rey del Gepids, murió. Por lo tanto, su hijo Cunimund tuvo éxito al lanzado. Aunque el Gepids había tenido ya un tratado de la paz con el Langobards, Cunimund rompió este tratado. En este mismo tiempo, Alboin había hecho un tratado eterno con el Avars. A pesar de todo el esto, Cunimund continuó forzando a su gente luchar. Cunimund anunció que si su gente pudiera superar el Langobards, después ella atacaría el Avars, que ahora ocupó las tierras del Gepids. Bajo dirección de Alboin, el Langobards era victorioso. El Langobards tenía un militares tan de gran alcance que redujeron el Gepids a la destrucción completa. Cunimund matado Alboin y hecho un cubilete fuera de su esquelético, conocido como scala. [PÁRRAFO: 1] El éxito de Alboin se había separado hasta ahora, esa palabra de sus militares de gran alcance se había separado a Roma. Roma buscó la ayuda de Alboin y del Langobards en su guerra contra el Goths. El Langobards fue transportado a Roma por el mar. Mucho a la esperanza del Romans, Alboin había reducido a rey del Goths, Totila, a un estado de la destrucción. El Langobards volvió a sus regalos y riquezas del cojinete del país. [PÁRRAFO: 1] Alboin, después de todo su éxito militar, ahora precisó para Italia. Él pidió ayuda del Saxons que alternadamente lo proveyó de 20.000 hombres para proceder a Italia. Alboin esperaba conducir a su gente en una migración a Italia. Él entonces dio Pannonia, el hogar actual del Langobards, a los Huns. Las únicas condiciones eran que si el Langobards fuera volver siempre, podrían tomar la posesión de Pannonia inmediatamente. Alboin primero entró en Venetia. Alboin declaró que su sobrino Gisulf sería el duque conquistado una vez. Gisulf exigió que Alboin te dé cualquier Langobard gente de su opción ante duque que se convierte. Alboin convino esta condición. [PÁRRAFO: 1] Alboin vino al río Piave primero. El obispo de la iglesia de Tarvisium, Felix, pidió que el rey te concediera la iglesia después de que la tierra fuera conquistada. Alboin era gracioso y concedió su petición. Alboin entonces se encendió capturar las ciudades de Vicenza, de Verona, y de las ciudades restantes de Venetia. Él capturó todas las ciudades por Padua, Monselice, y Mantua. Después de conquistar Venetia, Alboin movió a su ejército a Liguria. Él tomó todas las ciudades de Liguria excepto ésos situadas en las orillas. La ciudad de Pavía era una de las ciudades más duras a tomar. Duró tres años y algunos meses para entregarse a Alboin después de ser sitiado. Alboin tomó la posesión de todo hasta Toscana excepto Roma, Ravena, y algunos otros lugares fortificados. [PÁRRAFO: 1] El Romans era así que devastado por esta pérdida y la enfermedad que ocurrieron. Alboin había hecho voto a poner a toda la gente de estas ciudades conquistadas a la muerte. Sin embargo, Alboin era un buen hombre. Alboin rompió este voto y permitió que la gente viviera sin lesión. Alboin gobernó Italia para tres y una mitad de los años antes de ser asesinado por su esposa.

TEXT.English: [H1]Alfred the Great[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Anglo-Saxons[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] c. 849 AD - 899 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Alfred the Great was known as King Alfred (Aelfred) the Great, or King of Wessex, Alfred the Great became ruler of the West Saxons after he and his brother defeated the Danes in the Battle of Ashdown in Berkshire - the later death of his brother Ethelred left Alfred as successor in 871. He has the reputation of being a great warrior as well as a social reformer who built towns and promoted education by starting schools and translating texts from Latin. He is considered the first King of England.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although the Danes were defeated at Ashdown, the West Saxons were forced to negotiate and pay tribute after losing further battles. But Alfred refused to surrender and in 878, he rallied men from Somerset and Wiltshire and again defeated the Danes in the Battle of Edington. The Danes made peace and Guthrum, their king, was baptised with Alfred as his sponsor. By 886, Alfred had freed London from Danish occupation and a treaty was made with Guthrum and the East Anglians. England was divided, with the east (between the Rivers Thames and Tees) declared to be Danish territory - later known as the 'Danelaw' - where English and Danes were treated as equals by law.[PARAGRAPH:2]The failure of the Danes to make any more advances against Alfred was largely a result of the defensive measures he undertook during the war. He set about strengthening old forts and building new, and he ensured that his army was well organised. He also built up a navy to meet invasions. Larger ships were constructed to his own design for use against the coastal raids that continued even after 896.[PARAGRAPH:2]Alfred understood the value of diplomacy and formed amicable relations with Mercia and Wales; Welsh rulers sought his support and even provided troops for his army in 893. As an administrator Alfred advocated justice and order. He established a code of laws, after studying the principles of law-giving in the Book of Exodus and the codes of Aethelbert of Kent, Ine of Wessex and Offa of Mercia. While avoiding unnecessary changes to custom, he limited the practice of the blood feud and imposed heavy penalties for breach of oath or pledge.[PARAGRAPH:2]A most distinguishing characteristic was Alfred's belief in education. He held the view that Viking raids were a divine punishment for peoples' sins, which he attributed to the decline of learning, and so he offered patronage to scholars from Wales and the continent and he himself learned Latin, eventually translating books into English.[PARAGRAPH:2]Alfred is still considered quintessential as a ruler of the Middle Ages. He resisted constant threat from the Danes while establishing himself as a wise and lawful ruler of not only the Anglo-Saxons, but of England.

[H1]Alooma[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mai of the Kanem-Bornu Empire[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]1571 - 1603[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Idris Alooma was mai (king) of the Kanem-Bornu Empire, located mainly in Chad and Nigeria. An outstanding statesman, under his rule (1571-1603) Kanem-Bornu touched the zenith of its power. Idris is remembered for his military skills, administrative reforms, and Islamic piety. His feats are mainly known through his chronicler Ahmad bin Fartuwa.[PARAGRAPH:1]His main adversaries were the Hausa to the west, the Tuareg and Toubou to the north, and the Bulala to the east. One epic poem extols his victories in 330 wars and more than 1,000 battles. His innovations included the employment of fixed military camps (with walls); permanent sieges and "scorched earth" tactics, where soldiers burned everything in their path; armored horses and riders; and the use of Berber camelry, Kotoko boatmen, and iron-helmeted musketeers trained by Turkish military advisers. His active diplomacy featured relations with Tripoli, Egypt, and the Ottoman Empire, which sent a 200-member ambassadorial party across the desert to Alooma's court at Ngazargamu. Alooma also signed what was probably the first written treaty or cease-fire in Chadian history.[PARAGRAPH:1]Alooma introduced a number of legal and administrative reforms based on his religious beliefs and Islamic law (sharia). He sponsored the construction of numerous mosques and made a pilgrimage to Mecca, where he arranged for the establishment of a hostel to be used by pilgrims from his empire. As with other dynamic politicians, Alooma's reformist goals led him to seek loyal and competent advisers and allies, and he frequently relied on slaves who had been educated in noble homes. Alooma regularly sought advice from a council composed of heads of the most important clans. He required major political figures to live at the court, and he reinforced political alliances through appropriate marriages (Alooma himself was the son of a Kanuri father and a Bulala mother).[PARAGRAPH:1]Kanem-Bornu under Alooma was strong and wealthy. Government revenue came from tribute (or booty, if the recalcitrant people had to be conquered), sales of slaves, and duties on and participation in trans-Saharan trade. Unlike West Africa, the Chadian region did not have gold. Still, it was central to one of the most convenient trans-Saharan routes. Between Lake Chad and Fezzan lay a sequence of well-spaced wells and oases, and from Fezzan there were easy connections to North Africa and the Mediterranean Sea. Many products were sent north, including natron (sodium carbonate), cotton, kola nuts, ivory, ostrich feathers, perfume, wax, and hides, but the most important of all were slaves. Imports included salt, horses, silks, glass, muskets, and copper.[PARAGRAPH:1]Alooma took a keen interest in trade and other economic matters. He is credited with having the roads cleared, designing better boats for Lake Chad, introducing standard units of measure for grain, and moving farmers into new lands. In addition, he improved the ease and security of transit through the empire with the goal of making it so safe that "a lone woman clad in gold might walk with none to fear but God.

[H1]Amanishakheto[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kandake of Nubia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] c.20 BC - 20 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Amanishakheto (aka - Amanishabheto) was a kandake of Nubia. Kandake ('Candace' in English) was the title for female rulers of the ancient African state of Kush. The capital region of the Kushite empire was centered in Sudan, but the empire extended all through Africa and including Egypt. They formed a series of Nubian warrior queens, queens regnant, and queen mothers that ruled Kush in an unbroken line for over one thousand years. At an earlier period, men had ruled or shared rule with them. By the time of Emperor Augustus, documented accounts of solitary female rulers had emerged.[PARAGRAPH:1]Amanishakheto succeeded the Candace Amanirenas. She was Crown Princess for several years before she became Empress. When the Roman Emperor Augustus attempted to conquer Nubia, she fought the Roman Army in three battles from 24-21 BCE. When the Augustus attempted to tax the Kushites, she and her son Akinidad attacked a Roman fort in Egypt. The Romans eventually negotiated peace. She was succeeded by her daughter, Amanitore.[PARAGRAPH:1]She seems to have reigned from 10 BCE to 1 CE, although most dates of Nubian history before the Middle ages are very uncertain. Amanishakheto is known from several monuments. She is mentioned in the Amun-temple of Kawa, on a stela from Meroe, and in inscriptions of a palace building found at Wad ban Naqa, from a stela found at Qasr Ibrim, another stela from Naqa and her pyramid at Meroe. Her titles were Candace and later qore, which means king.[PARAGRAPH:1]Amanishakheto is best known from a treasure of jewellery recovered in 1834 from her pyramid in Meroe. These pieces are now in the Egyptian Museum of Berlin and Munich.

[H1]Amina Sukhera[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gimbiya of Zazzau[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] 1533 - 1610[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Amina Sukhera (also called Aminatu) was a Muslim princess of the royal family of Zazzau (now Zaria), in what is now northeast Nigeria. She was born c. 1533 and is estimated to have died around 1610. Amina was a preeminent gimbiya (princess) but various theories exist as to the time of her reign or if she ever was a queen. One explanation states that she reigned from approximately 1536 to 1573, while another posits that she became queen after her brother Karama's death, in 1576. Yet another claims that although she was a leading princess, she was never a queen. The Arabic female name Amina means truthful and trustworthy.[PARAGRAPH:1]When Amina was seven years old her mother, Bakwa Turunku, became queen. During this point in her life, she became involved in the Zazzau military, earning much admiration for her bravery. Her military achievements brought her great wealth and power. She is credited as the architect of the earthen walls around the city of Zaria, for which the providence is named. These walls are often referred to as Ganuwar Amina. It is a subject of debate as to whether or not Amina was actually queen, but she was responsible for conquering many of the cities in the area surrounding Zazzau.[PARAGRAPH:1]According to those who believe that she did ascend to the throne, in her thirty-four year reign she expanded the domaain of Zazzau to its largest size. Some sources state that her main focus was not on the annexation of neighboring lands, but on forcing local rulers to accept vassal status and permit Hausa traders safe passage.[PARAGRAPH:1]The introduction of kola nuts into cultivation in the area is attributed to Amina. A statue at the National Arts Theatre in Lagos State honors her, and multiple educational institutions bear her name.

[H1]Andranik Toros Ozanian[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]National Hero of Armenia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] 1865 - 1927 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The first name in the Armenian struggle for national liberation in modern times is Andranik. "Like an eagle he soars over the mountains and ridges." Andranik Toros Ozanian was born in historic Shabin-Karahisar ("Shabin, the black fortress," 80 miles northeast of Erzurum). He was destined more, perhaps, than any of the other Armenian revolutionaries, to provide leadership, rationality, acumen, prudence, and effectiveness to Armenia's rising up against the brutal Ottoman oppression. Even during his adolescence Andranik recognized the pattern of Ottoman oppression and the sufferings of his people. So it was that at the tender age of 22, having lost his wife and two children, Andranik joined a partisan group formed in his native town. Inspired with the ideals of liberation for his people, Andranik went to Constantinople to meet those who had already been deeply involved in the liberation movement. He readily accepted tasks assigned to him.[PARAGRAPH:1]When the leader, Serob Aghbiur, of a fighting group which Andranik had joined, was killed, Andranik was named leader. It was in 1901 when his fighting group held out in the Arakelots Vank against an overwhelmingly superior force that Andranik's name became famous for his effectiveness as a revolutionary leader. There were many more similar occurrences to come. Andranik, at first, joined the Hunchak party; it was through party organization that he could be effective in securing men and material with which to carry on. But disagreement with party policies led Andranik to leave the Hunchak ranks and join the Dashnak party.[PARAGRAPH:1]There too, when that party engaged in practices judged to be wrong in principle, Andranik resigned. During the period 1907-13 Andranik committed his energies to helping the Bulgarian liberation movement. In it he created an Armenian division, which brought honor to itself by its effective participation. For his efforts Andranik was decorated and commissioned an officer. With World War I under way (1914-1918) Andranik went to the Caucasus and assisted in organizing Armenian battle units to fight the Turks alongside the Russian army units. In 1915 Andranik was named commander of all Armenian volunteer units within the Russian army.[PARAGRAPH:1]The overthrow of the Tsarist regime in Russia (1917) and the consequent collapse of the Russian imperial army found Andranik on the side of the working class out of which the social revolution in Russia had arisen. Early in 1918 he began to organize a separate army to liberate western Armenia. Made a Major General, Andranik had many thousands under his command, Armenian soldiers from the old Russian army, and many thousand Armenians who had volunteered from all over the world. However, short on re-sources and back-up military fighting units, Andranik had to abandon his plan to take Erzurum. With the collapse of the Tsarist Russian government an independent Armenian Republic was set up in May 1918. Andranik was in sympathy with the social principles that came with the new Russian order and desired to maintain amicable relations with Russia. However, Armenia's ruling party, the Dashnaks, did not favor such a relationship. As a result Andranik once again had a falling out with them. The brilliant defense of Zangezur (1918-19) under Andranik's command marked the end of his military career.[PARAGRAPH:1]Leaving Armenian lands he traveled to Europe and eventually to America (1922), finally settling in Fresno, California, with his new wife. His name and fame enabled him to be effective in fund-raising activities in America for aid to Armenian orphans. His life in Fresno, with frequent visits elsewhere in response to calls, was spent very much in the public eye. But his health was failing. While seeking to regain strength in a sanatorium in Chico, California, the death that he had eluded in his many years of fierce battle encounters, now finally caught up with him. The date was August 31, 1927. City-wide public attention was accorded him at his funeral in Fresno, where he was interred (September 7, 1927) in the Ararat Cemetery. A few months later Andranik's remains were exhumed and taken to Paris (accompanied by his widow) for a second funeral service and interment. Few heroes have been as well acclaimed during their lives as was Andranik.[PARAGRAPH:1]

[H1]Andrea Gritti[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Doge of Venice[NEWLINE]Lived: [\BOLD] 1455 - 1538[NEWLINE]Gritti was born in Bardolino, near Verona. He spent much of his early life in Constantinople, looking after Venetian interests. In 1499, he was imprisoned on charges of espionage, but escaped execution due to his friendship with the vizier, and was released several years later. Elected Doge in 1523, Gritti concluded a treaty with Charles V, ending Venice's active involvement in the Italian Wars. He attempted to maintain the neutrality of the Republic in the face of the continued struggle between Charles and Francis, urging both to turn their attention to the advances of the Ottoman Empire in Hungary. However, he could not prevent Suleiman I from attacking Corfu in 1537, drawing Venice into a war with the Ottomans. He died in 1538.Elected Doge in 1523, Gritti concluded a treaty with Charles V, ending Venice's active involvement in the Italian Wars.
