TEXT.English: [H1]Sepé Tiaraju[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]??? - 1756[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sepé Tiaraju was an indigenous Guarani leader born in the Jesuit reduction mission of São Luiz Gonzaga and who died on February 7, 1756, in the municipality of São Gabriel, in the present-day state of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. Sepé Tiaraju led the fight against the Portuguese and Spanish colonial powers in the Guerras Guaraníticas (Guarani War) and was killed three days before a massacre that killed around fifteen hundred of his fellow warriors. After two hundred and fifty years of the date of his death he still remains a very influential figure in the popular imagination, considered a saint by some. This conflict in South America resulted from the land demarcations established by the European powers with the Tratado de Madrid (1750). According to this treaty the Guarani population inhabiting the Jesuit missions in the region had to be evacuated. After one hundred and fifty years living a unique communal life, neither the prospect of returning to the forests nor moving to another place were considered as options by most mission Guaranis. Further treaties such as the San Idelfonso Treaty (1777) and the Badajoz Treaty (1801) still grappled with issues related to this topic. The Christianized Guarani population residing in the Jesuit missions (called missões or reduções, in Portuguese), that is in Brazil, Paraguay and Argentina combined, is estimated to have numbered approximately eighty thousand at the start of the conflict. At that time these so called evangelized Guaranis - as opposed to the many Guaranis living the traditional way and not in the Jesuit missions - raised what is believed to have been the largest herd of cattle in all of Latin America. Therefore, the Europeans' interests in the area extended beyond land appropriations. Sepé Tiaraju was immortalized in the letters by Brazilian writer Basílio da Gama in the epic poem O Uraguai (1769) and in the poem "O Lunar de Sepé", collected by Simões Lopes Neto and published in the beginning of the 20th century. Since then, he has been a character in many major literary works, like "O tempo e o vento" ["The time and the wind"], by Erico Verissimo. The expression and battle cry "Esta terra tem dono!" (or "This land has owners!") is attributed to Sepé Tiaraju.

[H1]Shambara[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Harappa[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Not much about the Indus Valley culture is known, let alone its kings. Because its language is not yet known, much of the information about Shambara is taken from myth and through the Vedas. Shambara was the primary non-Aryan or Dasyu, a people of the Indus Valley, enemy of the Vedic people. Shambara is known through Divodasa, a king of the Vedics. Divodasa defeated Shambara and conquered his hundred cities, leading many scholars to think that Shambara was a great king who had much land under his sway.
TEXT.French: [H1]Shambara[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Roi d'Harappa[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Biographie :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Pas grand chose de la culture de la vallée de l'Indus est connu, sans parler de ses rois. Parce que son langage n'est pas encore connue, la plupart des informations sur Shambara est tiré mythe et à travers les Védas. Shambara a été le premier non-aryens ou Dasyu, un peuple de la vallée de l'Indus, ennemi du peuple védique. Shambara est connu à travers Divodasa, un roi de la Vedics. Divodasa vaincu et conquis son Shambara centaine de villes, ce qui conduit de nombreux chercheurs à penser que Shambara fut un grand roi qui avait beaucoup de terres sous son emprise.
TEXT.German: [H1]Gilgamesch[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]König von Harappa[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Nicht viel über die Kultur des Indus-Tal ist bekannt, geschweige denn ihre Könige. Weil seine Sprache ist noch nicht bekannt, einen Großteil der Informationen über Shambara wird von Mythos und durch die Veden. Shambara war der primäre nicht-arischen oder Dasyu, ein Volk von der Indus-Tal, der Feind der Vedischen Menschen. Shambara ist bekannt durch Divodasa, ein König der Vedics. Divodasa besiegt und erobert seine Shambara hundert Städte, viele der führenden Gelehrten zu glauben, dass Shambara war ein großer König, der hatte viel Land unter seiner Herrschaft.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Shambara[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Re di Harappa[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB] Non molto circa la cultura della Valle è conosciuta, e tanto meno il suo re. Perché la sua lingua non è ancora noto, gran parte delle informazioni su Shambara è tratto dal mito e attraverso i Veda. Shambara è stato il primo non-ariana "o Dasyu, un popolo di Indus Valley, nemico del popolo vedica. Shambara è conosciuto attraverso Divodasa, un re dei Vedics. Divodasa sconfitto Shambara cento e conquistò la sua città, che porta molti studiosi a pensare che Shambara è stato un grande re, che aveva molto terreno sotto la sua influenza.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Shambara[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rey de Harappa[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]No se mucho sobre la cultura del Indus Valle es conocido, por no hablar de sus reyes. Debido a su idioma no se conoce todavía, gran parte de la información acerca de Shambara está tomada del mito y a través de los Vedas. Shambara fue el principal no ario o Dasyu, un pueblo del valle de Indus, enemigo de los pueblos védicos. Shambara se conoce a través de Divodasa, un rey de la Vedics. Divodasa derrotado y conquistado su Shambara cien ciudades, llevando a muchos estudiosos piensan que Shambara fue un gran rey que había mucha tierra bajo su dominio.

TEXT.English: [H1]Shaushtatar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Mitanni[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Reigned:[\BOLD] c. 1410 - 1440 BC[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shaushtatar was a king of the Hurrian kingdom of Mitanni in the fifteenth century BC. He was born to Barattarna, the previous king of Mitanni. Barattarna had established control over northern Mesopotamia. Here, he installed several client kings with Hurrian names in various cities. It was left however for Shaushtatar to complete the conquest of the region and establish the Mitanni as a world power. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Now freed from the constant threat undergone by Mitanni of the Egyptians, Shaushtatar turned his attention toward Assyria. He invaded Assyria and sacked and looted its capital, Assur. He then turned westward across the Euphrates, along the way gathering beneath his sway all the northern Syrian states as he brought his army to the Mediterranean coast. He was looking to extend Mitanni's power further south, possibly into Palestine. However, much of southern Syria still lay within the Egyptian sphere of influence, which had long been a threat to Mitanni. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Shaushtatar wished to now increase Mitanni's territory by conquering Palestine, which already had a significant Hurrian population. The consequence to his actions was, however, a war against Egypt. Although the Mitanni military successes against Egyptian forces in the region may have been successful, the long term risks were substantial. Earlier in his reign, when he had invaded Assyria, neither Assyria nor Kassite Babylon posed a serious threat to Mitanni expansion. The only major state likely to oppose him was Hatti. However, the Hittite Kingdom had not yet fully regained its former strength, but did once again expand into many Anatolian territories lost to it after Mursili's assassination. It was only a matter of time before the Hittites once again turned to Mitanni, which would pose a serious threat. If at that time Mitanni was at war with Egypt, it would be caught in a conflict between two powerful enemies. However, it would not be Shaushtatar who would confront these problems, but his son, Artatama I, who would negotiate with the pharaoh Amenhotep II over an alliance.
TEXT.French: [H1]Shaushtatar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Roi de Mitanni[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Regna :[\BOLD] 1410 approx.- 1440 av. J.C.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Biographie :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shaushtatar fut un roi du royaume de hourrite Mitaniens au XVe siècle av. Il est né à Barattarna, l'ancien roi de Mitaniens. Barattarna avaient établi un contrôle sur le nord de la Mésopotamie. Ici, il a installé plusieurs clients rois avec hourrite noms dans différentes villes. Il a été cependant laissé pour Shaushtatar pour achever la conquête de la région et d'établir les Mitaniens comme une puissance mondiale. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Maintenant, libérée de la constante threat Mitaniens subis par des Égyptiens, Shaushtatar tourné son attention vers l'Assyrie. Il a envahi et saccagé une Assyrie pillé sa capitale, Assur. Il s'est ensuite tourné vers l'ouest à travers l'Euphrate, le long du chemin rassemblement sous son emprise tout le nord syrien affirme que son armée, qu'il a prise à la côte méditerranéenne. Il cherchait à étendre son pouvoir Mitaniens plus au sud, peut-être en Palestine. Cependant, une grande partie du sud de la Syrie reste relève de la sphère d'influence égyptienne, qui a longtemps été une menace pour Mitaniens. [PARAGRAPH 1] Shaushtatar souhaite maintenant accroître Mitaniens du territoire par la conquête de la Palestine, qui avait déjà une importante population hourrite. La conséquence de son action a été, cependant, une guerre contre l'Égypte. Bien que les Mitaniens succès militaires contre les forces égyptiennes dans la région ont été très bons, les risques à long terme sont importants. Plus tôt au cours de son règne, lorsqu'il avait envahi l'Assyrie, ni l'Assyrie ni Kassite de Babylone constituent une grave menace pour Mitaniens expansion. Le seul grand État susceptibles de s'opposer à lui est Hatti. Toutefois, le royaume hittite n'a pas encore pleinement retrouvé son ancienne force, mais il n'a une fois de plus à conquérir de nombreux territoires perdus à anatolienne après l'assassinat de Mursili. Ce n'était qu'une question de temps avant que les Hittites une nouvelle fois tournés vers Mitaniens, ce qui constituerait une grave menace. Si, à ce moment Mitaniens était en guerre avec l'Égypte, il serait pris dans un conflit entre deux ennemis puissants. Toutefois, il ne serait pas Shaushtatar qui seraient confrontés à ces problèmes, mais son fils, Artatama I, qui va négocier avec le pharaon Aménophis II sur une alliance.
TEXT.German: [H1]Shaushtatar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]König von Mitanni[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Regierte:[\BOLD] ca. 1410 - 1440 v. Chr. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shaushtatar war ein König der Hurrian Reich von Mitanni im fünfzehnten Jahrhundert v. Chr.. Er wurde geboren, um Barattarna, den früheren König von Mitanni. Barattarna hatte die Kontrolle über nördlichen Mesopotamien. Hier hat er mehrere Client installiert Hurrian Könige mit Namen in verschiedenen Städten. Es blieb jedoch für Shaushtatar um die Eroberung der Region und die Mitanni als Weltmacht. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Nun befreit von der ständigen Diskussion unterzogen von Mitanni der Ägypter, Shaushtatar wandte seine Aufmerksamkeit auf Assyrien. Er erobert Assyrien und entließ ein geplündert seine Hauptstadt Assur. Er drehte dann westwärts über den Euphrat, auf dem Weg sammelt unter seiner Herrschaft alle syrischen nördlichen Staaten gebracht, als er seine Armee an der Mittelmeerküste. Er war auf der Suche zu erweitern Mitanni Macht weiter südlich, möglicherweise in Palästina. Ein Großteil der südlichen Syrien lag noch in der ägyptischen Einflussbereich, die schon lange eine Bedrohung für die Mitanni. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Shaushtatar wollte jetzt erhöhen Mitanni-Gebiet durch Eroberung Palästina, die bereits einen erheblichen Hurrian Bevölkerung. Die Konsequenz für sein Handeln war aber ein Krieg gegen Ägypten. Obwohl die Mitanni militärische Erfolge gegen die ägyptischen Truppen in der Region wurden sehr gut, die langfristigen Risiken waren beträchtlich. Zu Beginn seiner Regierungszeit, als er Assyrien erobert hatte, weder noch Kassite Assyrien Babylon, die eine ernsthafte Bedrohung für Mitanni Expansion. Der einzige große Staat wahrscheinlich gegen ihn wurde Hatti. Allerdings ist die hethitischen Königreich noch nicht in vollem Umfang zu seiner ehemaligen Stärke, aber haben noch einmal erweitern in viele anatolischen Territorien verloren die ihm nach der Ermordung Murili. Es war nur eine Frage der Zeit, bis die Hethiter wieder wandte sich Mitanni, die eine ernsthafte Bedrohung. Wenn zu diesem Zeitpunkt Mitanni war im Krieg mit Ägypten, es wäre gefangen in einem Konflikt zwischen zwei mächtige Feinde. Aber es wäre nicht Shaushtatar konfrontieren, würde diese Probleme, aber sein Sohn, Artatama ich, die würden Verhandlungen mit dem Pharao Amenophis II. über eine Allianz.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Shaushtatar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Re di Mitanni[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Regnava:[\BOLD] ca. 1410 - 1440 a.C. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shaushtatar era un re del regno di Mitanni Hurrian nel XV secolo aC. Egli è nato per Barattarna, il precedente re di Mitanni. Barattarna aveva stabilito il controllo su Mesopotamia settentrionale. Qui, ha installato vari client di re con Hurrian nomi in varie città. E 'stato tuttavia sinistra per Shaushtatar per completare la conquista della regione e creare le Mitanni come una potenza mondiale. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ora liberato dalla costante filo da subito Mitanni degli Egiziani, Shaushtatar rivolto la sua attenzione verso l'Assiria. Ha invaso l'Assiria e saccheggiata uno saccheggiato la sua capitale, Assur. Egli ha quindi rivolto ad ovest attraverso l'Eufrate, lungo il percorso di raccolta sotto la sua influenza tutti gli stati del nord siriano come egli ha portato il suo esercito per la costa mediterranea. Egli stava cercando di estendere il potere Mitanni più a sud, possibilmente in Palestina. Tuttavia, gran parte del sud della Siria ancora laici all'interno della sfera di influenza egiziana, che era stata a lungo una minaccia per la Mitanni. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Shaushtatar voluto adesso Mitanni aumento del territorio da conquistare la Palestina, che già ha avuto un significativo Hurrian popolazione. La conseguenza per le sue azioni è stata, comunque, una guerra contro l'Egitto. Sebbene il Mitanni successi militari contro le forze egiziane nella regione potrebbe essere stato molto buono, a lungo termine, i rischi sono notevoli. Anteriore e il suo regno, quando aveva invaso Assiria, né Assiria, né Kassite Babylon posta una grave minaccia per la Mitanni espansione. L'unico grande stato in grado di opporsi a lui è stato Hatti. Tuttavia, il Regno ittita non era ancora pienamente recuperato il suo ex forza, ma ancora una volta ha fatto espandere in molti territori perduti Anatolian ad essa dopo l'assassinio Mursili. Era solo una questione di tempo prima che il Ittiti, ancora una volta si è rivolto a Mitanni, che potrebbe rappresentare una seria minaccia. Se a quel tempo Mitanni era in guerra con l'Egitto, sarebbe stato catturato in un conflitto tra due potenti nemici. Tuttavia, non sarebbe Shaushtatar che affrontare questi problemi, ma il suo figlio, Artatama I, che sarebbe negoziare con il faraone Amenhotep II, in una alleanza.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Shaushtatar[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rey de Mitanni[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Reino:[\BOLD] c. 1410 - 1440 a. C. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shaushtatar fue un rey de los hurritas reino de Mitanni en el siglo XV aC. Él nació a Barattarna, el anterior rey de Mitanni. Barattarna ha establecido el control sobre el norte de Mesopotamia. Aquí, el cliente instalado varios reyes con nombres hurritas en varias ciudades. Se dejó sin embargo de Shaushtatar para completar la conquista de la región y establecer el Mitanni como potencia mundial. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ahora liberados de la constante hilo de Mitanni sufrido por los egipcios, Shaushtatar dirigió su atención hacia Asiria. Asiria invadió y saqueó un saquearon su capital, Assur. Se dirigió hacia el oeste a través del Eufrates, a lo largo del camino de reunión bajo su dominio todos los estados del norte de Siria como él trajo a su ejército a la costa mediterránea. Él estaba buscando ampliar el poder de Mitanni más al sur, posiblemente en Palestina. Sin embargo, gran parte del sur de Siria todavía quedaban dentro de la esfera de influencia egipcia, que ha sido durante mucho tiempo una amenaza para Mitanni. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Shaushtatar desea ahora aumentar Mitanni por la conquista del territorio de Palestina, que ya tenía una importante población hurritas. La consecuencia de sus acciones es, sin embargo, una guerra contra Egipto. Aunque el Mitanni éxitos militares contra fuerzas egipcias en la región puede haber sido muy buena, a largo plazo, los riesgos son considerables. A comienzos de su reinado, cuando había invadido Asiria, ni Asiria ni Kassite Babilonia que plantean una grave amenaza para la expansión de Mitanni. El único gran estado probable que se le oponen Hatti. Sin embargo, el Reino hitita aún no ha recuperado plenamente su antigua fuerza, pero una vez más expandir en muchos territorios de Anatolia perdido a él después del asesinato de Mursili. Es sólo una cuestión de tiempo antes de los hititas, una vez más, recurrió a Mitanni, que constituiría una grave amenaza. Si en ese momento Mitanni estaba en guerra con Egipto, que se ven atrapados en un conflicto entre dos enemigos poderosos. Sin embargo, no sería Shaushtatar que enfrentar estos problemas, pero su hijo, Artatama I, que negociar con el faraón Amenhotep II más de una alianza.

TEXT.English: [H1]Shin Sawbu[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Queen Regnant of Hanthawaddy[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] 1394 - 1472 [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shin Sawbu was the only daughter of the Mon King Razadarit who had two sons as well. She was born on Wednesday in 1394 to the chief queen Thuddhamaya. At birth she was given the name Viharadevi, which likely means "queen of the monastery". At age 20 she was married to Binnya Bwe (Smin Chesao), Razadarit's nephew and had a son, Binnya Waru and two daughters, Netaka Taw and Netaka Thin. Her husband died when she was just 25. In 1422, Sawbu's father King Razadarit died. The king's eldest son Binnya Dhammaraza ascended the throne but his younger brothers Binnya Ran and Binnya Kyan rebelled. By the invitation of Binnya Kyan, King Thihathu of Ava came down with an army. Binnya Dhammaraza pacified his brothers by making Binnya Ran the crown prince as well as giving the governorship of the Irrawaddy delta, and Binnya Kyan the governorship of Martaban. Crown Prince Binnya Ran in a gesture of peace presented his sister Shin Sawbu to Thihathu, who in turn presented a princess of Ava to marry Binnya Ran. When Shin Sawbu went to Ava, she was 29 years old, a widow and a mother with a son and two daughters. During the time she resided at Ava, she did not have any additional children. King Thihathu was very fond of her but he died during a military expedition in the north in 1426. Shin Sawbu remained in Ava for four more years. During her residence at Ava, Shin Sawbu became the patron of two Mon monks, Dhammanyana and Pitakahara, who resided at the Ariyadhaza monastery at Sagaing near Ava. In 1430, after seven years of living at Ava, at the age of 36, the queen escaped with the help of her Mon monk preceptors and returned to Pegu accompanied by them.All members of Pegu's male line to the throne having been exhausted, Shin Sawbu ascended the throne as queen in 1453. Two of her brothers, Binnya Dhammayaza and Banya Ran I, and one of her sons, Binnya Waru, had already ruled as kings of Pegu. In 1457, shortly after ascending the throne, the Buddhist world celebrated the two thousandth anniversary of the Buddha's Paranirvana which in Southeast Asia is dated to the year 543 B.C. After ruling Pegu for around seven years, in 1460 she decided to abdicate and move from Pegu to Dagon where she could lead a life of religious devotion next to the Shwedagon pagoda. Shin Sawbu chose a monk to succeed her on the throne of Pegu. The monk Pitakahara, who had helped her escape from Ava, left the sangha, was given the titles Punnaraja and Dhammazedi, and became her son-in-law and a suitable heir to the throne by marrying her younger daughter Mipakathin.Shin Sawbu lived in Dagon next to the Shwedagon Pagoda until the end of her life in 1470 or 1472. Even after she moved to Dagon she is said to have still worn a crown. The actually handing over of power from Shin Sawbu to Dhammazedi, who became king under the title Ramadhipati in the year 1457, is commemorated in an inscription written in the Mon language. In Dagon, the queen devoted her time and attention to the Shwedagon pagoda, enlarging the platform around the pagoda, paving it with stones and placing stone posts and lamps around the outside of the pagoda. She extended the glebe lands supporting the pagoda to Danok. Almost everything that Shin Sawbu did, she did in multiples of four: "There were four white umbrellas, four golden alms-bowls, four earthenware vessels, and four offerings were made each day. There were twenty-seven men who prepared the lamps each day. There were twenty men as guardians of the pagoda treasury. There were four goldsmith's shops, four orchestras, four drums, four sheds, eight doorkeepers, four sweepers, and twenty lamp lighters. She built round and strengthened the sevenfold wall. Between the walls Her Majesty Banya Thau had them plant palmyra and coconut trees." She also had her own weight in gold (25 viss) beaten out into gold leaf and covered the Shwedagon pagoda with this gold leaf. The inhabitants of Dagon donated 5,000 viss of bronze to the pagoda.

[H1]Shishunaga[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Founder of the Shishunaga Dynasty of the Magadha Empire[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD] c. 413 - 395 BC [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Shishunaga (or Shusunaga) was the founder of the Shishunaga dynasty of the Magadha Empire in the present day northern India. Initially, he was an amatya (official) of the Magadha empire under the Haryanka dynasty. He was placed on the throne by the people who revolted against the Haryanka dynasty rule. The Puranas tell us that he placed his son at Varanasi and himself ruled from Girivraja (Rajagriha). Initially, his capital was Rajagriha and Vaishali was his second royal residence. Later he shifted his capital to Vaishali. His most significant achievement was the destruction of the 'glory' of the Pradyota dynasty of the Avanti kingdom. Most probably the king of Avanti whom Shishunaga humbled was Avantivardhana. The Magadhan victory must have been helped by the revolution that placed Aryaka on the thone of Ujjayini. He was succeeded by his son Kakavarna Kalashoka.

[H1]Simeon I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tsar of Bulgaria[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 864 - 927 AD [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Simeon was born in 864 as the third son of Knyaz Boris I. Simeon was born to a Christianized Bulgaria due to his father's reign. In his early years, Simeon learned the Greek language and received a theological education in Constantinople. Although Simeon's brother Vladimir was the designated heir of Boris, he was deposed after attempting to reintroduce paganism to Bulgaria and Simeon became king. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Under the Byzantine Emperor Leo VI, the Bulgarian marketplace was moved from Constantinople to Thessaloniki, where the Bulgarian merchants were heavily taxed. The merchants then required protection from Simeon, who invaded the Byzantine Empire in 894. However, the Bulgarian army was required back in the country after a Magyar invasion from the north. Later, the Magyars were convinced by the Byzantines to attack Bulgaria. Simeon, being unaware of this agreement, met another force of Byzantines from Italy. After agreeing to peace with the Byzantine commander, Simeon blocked off the Byzantine navy's route into the Danube. Simeon, after hearing of the Magyar attack, moved to confront them. The Magyars defeated Bulgaria and later pillaged its land, and Simeon agreed to peace with Byzantium in 895. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Now that the Byzantine threat was abolished, Simeon planned a campaign against the Magyars. Simeon defeated the Magyars and expanded Bulgarian territory. Simeon then defeated a Byzantine army after a dispute about Bulgarian prisoners in Thrace. The war ended and Byzantium was required to pay an annual tribute and cede lands to Bulgaria. However, Simeon often violated these treaties, conquering and attacking Byzantine territory on several occasions. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Leo VI's death paved the way for another Bulgarian invasion of Byzantium. Simeon was recognized as Emperor of the Bulgarians after negotiations with the Byzantines. In 917, the Byzantines planned a campaign against eh Bulgarians. In the Battle of Anchialos, one of the largest medieval battles in history, Simeon defeated the Byzantines. In order to cease Serbian unrest, Simeon removed the current Serbian ruler and replaced him with another, ensuring Bulgarian influence over Serbia. [PARAGRAPH: 1] After another government change in Constantinople, Simeon declared war on Byzantium to further assert his power. He captured several Byzantine cities and requested the help of the Arabs. However, the Arabs accepted peace with the Byzantines, thus ruining their alliance with Bulgaria. Simeon was forced to establish peace with Byzantium after the threat of a Serbian uprising, where he deposed the Serbian ruler. In 926, Simeon's troops invaded Croatia, but were defeated by the army of King Tomislav. In the last years of his life, Simeon prepared for another siege of Constantinople. On May 27, 927, Simeon died of heart failure in his palace in Preslav and was succeeded by his son Peter I.
TEXT.French: [H1]Siméon Ier[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tsar de Bulgarie[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Dates :[\BOLD] 864 - 927 ap. J.C.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Biographie :[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Simeon a été soutenu dans 864 en tant que troisième fils de Knyaz Boris I. Simeon a été soutenu en Bulgarie christianisée due au règne de son père. En ses premières années, Simeon a appris la langue grecque et a reçu une éducation théologique à Constantinople. Bien que le frère Vladimir de Simeon ait été l'héritier indiqué de Boris, il a été déposé après avoir essayé de réintroduire le paganisme en Bulgarie et Simeon est allé bien au roi. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Sous le Lion bizantin d'empereur VI, le marché bulgare a été déplacé de Constantinople à Thessaloniki, où les négociants bulgares ont été fortement imposés. Les négociants ont alors eu besoin de la protection contre Simeon, qui a envahi l'empire bizantin dans 894. Cependant, l'armée bulgare a été priée en arrière dans le pays après une invasion magyare du nord. Plus tard, les Magyars ont été convaincus par le Byzantines d'attaquer la Bulgarie. Simeon, étant ignorant de cet accord, a rencontré une autre force de Byzantines d'Italie. Après avoir été d'accord sur la paix avec le commandant bizantin, Simeon bloqué outre de l'itinéraire de la marine bizantine dans le Danube. Simeon, après avoir entendu parler de l'attaque magyare, s'est déplacé pour les confronter. Par Magyars la Bulgarie défaite Simeon et plus tard pillé sa terre, et était d'accord sur la paix avec Byzance dans 895. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Maintenant que la menace bizantine a été supprimée, Simeon a projeté une campagne contre les Magyars. Simeon a défait les Magyars et a augmenté le territoire bulgare. Simeon a alors défait une armée bizantine après un conflit au sujet des prisonniers bulgares dans Thrace. La guerre finie et Byzance ont été exigées pour payer un hommage annuel et pour céder des terres en Bulgarie. Cependant, Simeon a souvent violé ces traités, conquérant et attaquant le territoire bizantin à plusieurs occasions. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le Lion la mort de VI a préparé le terrain pour une autre invasion bulgare de Byzance. Simeon a été identifié comme empereur des Bulgares après des négociations avec le Byzantines. Dans 917, le bizantin a projeté une campagne contre hein des Bulgares. Dans la bataille d'Anchialos, une des plus grandes batailles médiévales dans l'histoire, Simeon a défait le Byzantines. Afin de cesser le malaise serbe, Simeon a enlevé la règle serbe courante et l'a remplacé avec des autres, assurant l'influence bulgare au-dessus de la Serbie. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Après qu'un autre changement de gouvernement à Constantinople, Simeon ait déclaré la guerre sur Byzance affirmer plus loin sa puissance. Il a capturé plusieurs villes bizantines et a demandé l'aide des Arabes. Cependant, les Arabes ont accepté la paix avec le Byzantines, de ce fait ruinant leur alliance avec la Bulgarie. Simeon a été forcé d'établir la paix avec Byzance après la menace d'un soulèvement serbe, où il a déposé le gouverneur serbe. Dans 926, les troupes de Simeon envahissent la Croatie, mais ont été défaites par l'armée du Roi Tomislav. En dernières années de sa vie, Simeon s'est préparé à un autre siège de Constantinople. Le 27 mai 927, Simeon mort de l'arrêt du coeur dans son palais dans Preslav et a été réussi par son fils Peter I.
TEXT.German: [H1]Simeon I.[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Zar von Bulgarien[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lebte:[\BOLD] 864 - 927 n. Chr. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Simeon wurde in 864 als der dritte Sohn von Knyaz Boris I. getragen. Simeon wurde zu einem Christianized Bulgarien wegen der Herrschaft seines Vaters getragen. In seinen frühen Jahren erlernte Simeon die griechische Sprache und empfing eine theological Ausbildung in Konstantinopolise. Obgleich Bruder Vladimir Simeons der gekennzeichnete Erbe von Boris war, wurde er abgesetzt, nachdem man versucht hatte, Heidentum nach Bulgarien wieder einzuführen und Simeon stand König. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Unter dem byzantinischen Kaiser-Löwen wurde VI, der bulgarische Markt von Konstantinopolise auf Thessaloniki verschoben, in dem die bulgarischen Kaufleute schwer besteuert wurden. Die Kaufleute benötigten dann Schutz vor Simeon, das das byzantinische Reich in 894 eindrang. Jedoch wurde die bulgarische Armee zurück im Land nach einer Magyarinvasion vom Norden angefordert. Später wurden die Magyars durch das Byzantines überzeugt, Bulgarien in Angriff zu nehmen. Simeon, seiend ahnungslos von dieser Vereinbarung, traf eine andere Kraft von Byzantines aus Italien. Nachdem dem Zustimmen Frieden mit dem byzantinischen Kommandanten, Simeon blockiert weg vom byzantinischen Weg der Marine in die Donau. Simeon, nachdem er von den Magyarangriff gehört hatte, bewog, um sie zu konfrontieren. Das Magyars besiegte Bulgarien und später geplündert seinem Land und Simeon stimmte Frieden mit Byzanz in 895 zu. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Nun da die byzantinische Drohung abgeschafft wurde, plante Simeon eine Kampagne gegen die Magyars. Simeon besiegte die Magyars und erweiterte bulgarische Gegend. Simeon besiegte dann eine byzantinische Armee nach einer Debatte über bulgarische Gefangene in Thrace. Der beendete Krieg und Byzanz wurden angefordert, einen jährlichen Tribut zu zahlen und Länder nach Bulgarien zu überlassen. Jedoch verletzte Simeon häufig diese Verträge und eroberte und nimmt byzantinische Gegend bei einigen Gelegenheiten in Angriff. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Löwe der Tod VI pflasterte die Weise für eine andere bulgarische Invasion von Byzanz. Simeon wurde als Kaiser der Bulgaren nach Vermittlungen mit dem Byzantines erkannt. In 917 plante das byzantinische eine Kampagne gegen wie Bulgaren. In der Schlacht von Anchialos, besiegte eine der größten mittelalterlichen Schlachten in der Geschichte, Simeon das Byzantines. Um serbische Ruhelosigkeit aufzuhören, entfernte Simeon die gegenwärtige serbische Lehre und ersetzte ihn mit anderen und stellte bulgarischen Einfluß über Serbien sicher. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Nachdem eine andere Regierung änderung in Konstantinopolise, Simeon Krieg auf Byzanz erklärte, seine Energie weiter zu erklären. Er nahm einige byzantinische Städte gefangen und bat um die Hilfe der Araber. Jedoch nahmen die Araber Frieden mit dem Byzantines an und so ruinierten ihr Bündnis mit Bulgarien. Simeon wurde gezwungen, Frieden mit Byzanz nach der Drohung eines serbischen Aufstiegs herzustellen, in dem er die serbische Lehre absetzte. In 926 dringen Truppen Simeons Kroatien ein, aber wurden von der Armee des Königs Tomislav besiegt. In den letzten Jahren seines Lebens, bereitete sich Simeon für eine andere Belagerung von Konstantinopolise vor. Am 27. Mai 927 wurde Simeon, das am Herzausfall in seinem Palast in Preslav gestorben wurde und von seinem Sohn Peter I. gefolgt.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Simeone I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Zar di Bulgaria[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vita:[\BOLD] 864 - 927 d.C. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Simeon è stato sopportato in 864 come il terzo figlio di Knyaz Boris I. Simeon è stato sopportato ad un Christianized Bulgaria dovuto il regno del suo padre. Durante i suoi primi anni, Simeon ha imparato la lingua greca ed ha ricevuto una formazione theological a Constantinople. Anche se il fratello Vladimir del Simeon era l'erede indicato di Boris, deposed dopo avere tentato di rintrodurre il paganism in Bulgaria e Simeon ha stato bene al re. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sotto il Leo Byzantine dell'imperatore VI, il mercato bulgaro è stato spostato da Constantinople verso Thessaloniki, dove i commercianti bulgari sono stati tassati pesante. I commercianti allora hanno richiesto la protezione da Simeon, che ha invaso l'impero Byzantine in 894. Tuttavia, l'esercito bulgaro è stato richiesto indietro nel paese dopo un'invasione del Magyar dal nord. Più successivamente, i Magyars sono stati convinti dal Byzantines attacare la Bulgaria. Simeon, essendo ignaro di questo accordo, ha venuto a contatto di un'altra forza di Byzantines dall'Italia. Dopo avere accosentitoe alla pace con il comandante Byzantine, Simeon ostruito fuori dell'itinerario del blu marino Byzantine nel Danubio. Simeon, dopo avere sentito parlare l'attacco del Magyar, si è mosso per confrontarlo. I Magyars hanno sconfitto la Bulgaria e più successivamente hanno saccheggiato la relativa terra e Simeon ha accosentito a pace con Byzantium in 895. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ora che la minaccia Byzantine si è abolita, Simeon ha progettato una campagna contro i Magyars. Simeon ha sconfitto i Magyars ed ha espanso il territorio bulgaro. Simeon allora ha sconfitto un esercito Byzantine dopo una disputa circa i prigionieri bulgari in Thrace. La guerra conclusa e Byzantium sono stati richiesti rendere tributo annuale e cedere le terre in Bulgaria. Tuttavia, Simeon ha violato spesso questi trattati, conquistanti ed attacanti il territorio Byzantine in parecchie occasioni. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Il Leo morte del VI ha aperto la strada per un'altra invasione bulgara di Byzantium. Simeon è stato riconosciuto come imperatore dei bulgari dopo le trattative con il Byzantines. In 917, il Byzantine ha progettato una campagna contro eh i bulgari. Nella battaglia di Anchialos, una di più grandi battaglie medioevali nella storia, Simeon ha sconfitto il Byzantines. Per cessare l'agitazione di Serbian, Simeon ha rimosso il righello corrente di Serbian e lo ha sostituito con un altro, accertando l'influenza bulgara sopra la Serbia. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Dopo che un altro cambiamento di governo a Constantinople, Simeon dichiari la guerra con Byzantium più ulteriormente di asserire la sua alimentazione. Ha bloccato parecchie città Byzantine ed ha chiesto l'aiuto degli arabi. Tuttavia, gli arabi hanno accettato la pace con il Byzantines, così rovinando la loro alleanza con la Bulgaria. Simeon è stato costretto a stabilire la pace con Byzantium dopo la minaccia di una rivolta di Serbian, in cui deposed il righello di Serbian. In 926, le truppe del Simeon invadono il Croatia, ma sono state sconfitte dall'esercito del re Tomislav. Durante gli anni scorsi della sua vita, Simeon si è preparato per un altro siege di Constantinople. Il 27 maggio 927, Simeon morto di guasto di cuore nel suo palazzo in Preslav ed è stato riuscito dal suo figlio Peter I.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Simeón I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Zar de Bulgaria[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vivió:[\BOLD] 864 - 927 d. C. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Simeon fue llevado en 864 como el tercer hijo de Knyaz Boris I. Simeon fue llevado a un Christianized Bulgaria debido al reinado de su padre. En sus años, Simeon aprendió la lengua griega y recibió una educación teológica en Constantinople. Aunque el hermano Vladimir de Simeon era el heredero señalado de Boris, lo depusieron después de procurar reintroducir paganism a Bulgaria y Simeon sintió bien al rey. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Debajo del Leo Byzantine del emperador VI, el mercado búlgaro fue movido desde Constantinople a Thessaloniki, donde gravaron a los comerciantes búlgaros pesadamente. Los comerciantes entonces requirieron la protección contra Simeon, que invadió el imperio Byzantine en 894. Sin embargo, requirieron al ejército búlgaro detrás en el país después de una invasión del Magyar del norte. Más adelante, se convenció a los Magyars por el Byzantines que atacaran Bulgaria. Simeon, siendo inconsciente de este acuerdo, resolvió otra fuerza de Byzantines de Italia. Después de convenir la paz con el comandante Byzantine, Simeon bloqueado de la ruta de la marina de guerra Byzantine en el Danubio. Simeon, después de oír hablar del ataque del Magyar, se movió para enfrentarlos. Los Magyars la Bulgaria derrotada Simeon y más adelante pillado su tierra, y convino la paz con Byzantium en 895. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ahora que la amenaza Byzantine fue suprimida, Simeon planeó una campaña contra los Magyars. Simeon derrotó a Magyars y amplió el territorio búlgaro. Simeon entonces derrotó a ejército Byzantine después de un conflicto sobre presos búlgaros en Thrace. La guerra terminada y Byzantium fueron requeridos pagar un tributo anual y ceder tierras a Bulgaria. Sin embargo, Simeon violó a menudo estos tratados, conquistando y atacando el territorio Byzantine en varias ocasiones. [PARAGRAPH: 1] El Leo la muerte de VI pavimentó la manera para otra invasión búlgara de Byzantium. Simeon fue reconocido como emperador de los búlgaros después de negociaciones con el Byzantines. En 917, el Byzantine planeó una campaña contra eh búlgaros. En la batalla de Anchialos, una de las batallas medievales más grandes de la historia, Simeon derrotó el Byzantines. Para cesar malestar servio, Simeon quitó la regla servia actual y lo substituyó por otro, asegurando influencia búlgara sobre Serbia. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Después de que otro cambio del gobierno en Constantinople, Simeon declarara guerra en Byzantium afirmar más lejos su energía. Él capturó varias ciudades Byzantine y solicitó la ayuda de los árabes. Sin embargo, los árabes aceptaron paz con el Byzantines, así arruinando su alianza con Bulgaria. Simeon fue forzado establecer paz con Byzantium después de la amenaza de una sublevación servia, donde él depuso la regla servia. En 926, las tropas de Simeon invaden el Croatia, pero fueron derrotadas por el ejército de rey Tomislav. En los años pasados de su vida, Simeon se preparó para otro sitio de Constantinople. El 27 de mayo de 927, Simeon muerto de paro cardíaco en su palacio en Preslav y fue tenido éxito por su hijo Peter I.

TEXT.English: [H1]Skilurus[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Scythia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]c.? - 108 BC [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Skilurus or Scylurus was the best known king of Scythia in the 2nd century BC. He was the son of a king and the father of a king, but the relation of his dynasty to the previous one is disputed. His realm included the lower reaches of the Borysthenes and Hypanis, as well as the northern part of Crimea, where his capital, Scythian Neapolis, was situated. Skilurus ruled over the Tauri and controlled the ancient trade emporium of Pontic Olbia, where he minted coins. In order to gain advantage against Chersonesos, he allied himself with the Sarmatian tribe of Rhoxolani. In response, Chersonesos forged an alliance with Mithridates VI of Pontus. Skilurus died during a war against Mithridates, a decisive conflict for supremacy in the Pontic steppe. Soon after his death, the Scythians were defeated by Mithridates (ca. 108 BC). Either Skilurus or his son and successor Palacus were buried in a mausoleum at Scythian Neapolis; it was used from ca. 100 BC to ca. 100 AD. Plutarch, in Sayings of Kings and Commanders, reports the following anecdote: "Scilurus on his death-bed, being about to leave eighty sons surviving, offered a bundle of darts to each of them, and bade them break them. When all refused, drawing out one by one, he easily broke them; thus teaching them that, if they held together, they would continue strong, but if they fell out and were divided, they would become weak."

[H1]John III Sobieski[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Poland[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1629 - 1696[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Born in 1629 in the small town of Olesko, John III Sobieski was the member of a notable noble family of Sobieszyn Sobieski of Clan Janina. After Sobieski graduated from Nowodworski College in Krakow, he graduated from the philosophical faculty of the Jagiellonian University. After completing his studies, John traveled with is brother Marek Sobieski through western Europe. During that time, he learned French German and Italian, in addition to Latin. Knowing these languages would be proved an important asset in his later military career. [PARAGRAPH: 1] After returning to Poland in 1648, John Sobieski volunteered for the army during the Chmielnicki Uprising and founded his own banner of cavalry, commanding it in the rank of Rotamaster. John fought with distinction in the Battle of Beresteczko much so that King John II Casimir sent him to the Ottoman Empire as an emissary. There, Sobieski learned the Tatar language and studied the Turkish military traditions and tactics. During the Swedish invasion of Poland, John Sobieski was a member of the Greater Polish regiments lead by Krzysztof Opalinski, Palatine of Poznan, swearing alliance to the Swedish king. However, John returned to the Polish side and fought for the king. [PARAGRAPH: 1] John III Sobieski brilliantly commanded a regiment of Tatar cavalry in the three-day long battle of Warsaw that year. After his success, he was promoted to the title Lord Standard-Bearer of the Crown. His military career also benefited during the Lubomirski Rebellion, where Sobieski remained loyal to the King. In 1655, he was promoted to rank of Grand Marshal of the Crown and later to the rank of Field Hetman of the Crown. Also in that year, he married Marie Casimire Louise de la Grange d'Arquien. After becoming a respected commander after his great victories in the Polish-Cossack-Tatar War, he achieved the highest military rank in the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, Grand Hetman of the Crown, and thus became the commander-in-chief of the Polish Army. [PARAGRAPH: 1] During the Polish-Ottoman War, Sobieski defeated the Turks in the battle of Chocim. News of this achievement spread throughout the country, making Sobieski the most popular personality since Michal I, King of Poland had died. On May 19 of the following year, he was elected the new monarch of the Commonwealth. John Sobieski was crowned John III on February 2, 1676. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski now faced the hardships of reviving the war-devastated Poland-Lithuania. Sobieski introduced a peace treaty with the Ottomans to cease the war in the south. In 1674, Sobieski called for war against the Turks and managed to capture several fortresses, now establishing a strong southern border for Poland in the Ukraine. In 1675, the Tatars attempted to retake the strategic town of Zorawno, but were unsuccessful. Thus, a peace treaty was signed soon after. With the signing of peace treaties, focus was turned from war to the reparation of the country and strengthening the royal authority. Although constantly stressed with Austria and Brandenburg, Sobieski reformed the Polish military. The military was reorganized, infantry's pikes replaced with battle-axes, and Polish cavalry adopting the formations of hussars and dragoons. Sobieski also increased the number of guns and developed new tactics for artillery. [PARAGRAPH: 1] At this time, Sobieski made several attempts to strengthen Poland against its enemies. In the end, he decided to ally himself with Leopold I, Holy Roman Emperor. He also joined the Holy League initiated by Pope Innocent XI to preserve Christendom. The alliance, although aimed against the Turks, had the advantage of gaining support for the defense of Poland's southern borders. After Polish spies uncovered Turkish preparations for a military campaign, Sobieski fortified the cities of Lwow and Krakow, which he feared were the targets of the Turkish campaigns. [PARAGRAPH: 1] One of Sobieski's greatest successes was in the victory at the Battle of Vienna, in joined command of Polish, Austrian, and German troops. Together, they fought the invading Turks under Kara Mustafa. He led a full attack of 81,000 men against 130,000 Turks which were divided between the attacking of the town and fighting of the united army. Sobieski later led four hussar cavalry groups into a charge down the hillside. Soon, the Turkish battle line was broken and the Battle of Vienna ended. [PARAGRAPH: 1] King John III Sobieski died in Wilanow, Poland on June 17, 1696. He and his wife, who died in 1716 in France, are buried together in Wawel Cathedral in Krakow, Poland. He was succeeded by Augustus II, whose death lead to a struggle for the crown of Poland, known as the War of the Polish Succession.
TEXT.French: [H1]Jean III Sobieski[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Roi de Pologne[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Régné:[\BOLD] 1629 - 1696[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Biographie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Né en 1629 dans la petite ville de Olesko, Jean III Sobieski était le membre d'une remarquable famille noble de l'd'Sobieszyn Sobieski Clan Janina. Après Sobieski diplômé de Nowodworski College à Cracovie, il est diplômé de la faculté philosophique de l'Université Jagellon. Après avoir terminé ses études, John voyagé avec Marek Sobieski est frère à travers l'Europe occidentale. Pendant ce temps, il a appris le français en allemand et en italien, en plus de latine. Connaissant ces langues serait avéré un atout important dans ses dernières carrière militaire. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Après son retour en Pologne en 1648, Jean Sobieski porté volontaire pour l'armée pendant la Chmielnicki Uprising et a fondé sa propre bannière de la cavalerie, commandant dans le rang de Rotamaster. John combattu avec distinction dans la bataille de Beresteczko au point que le roi Jean II Casimir lui a envoyé à l'Empire ottoman comme un émissaire. Là, Sobieski appris la langue tatare et étudié les traditions militaires turcs et tactiques. Au cours de l'invasion de la Pologne suédois, Jean Sobieski a été membre de la Grande Pologne régiments de plomb par Krzysztof Opalinski, Palatin de Posnanie, jurant alliance pour le roi suédois. Toutefois, John retourné à la partie polonaise et lutté pour le roi. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Jean III Sobieski brillamment commandé un régiment de cavalerie tatare, dans les trois jours longue bataille de Varsovie cette année. Après son succès, il a été promu au titre Seigneur Standard - porteur de la Couronne. Sa carrière militaire a également bénéficié au cours de la rébellion Lubomirski, où Sobieski restés fidèles au Roi. En 1655, il a été promu au grade de Grand Maréchal de la Couronne et, plus tard, au rang de Hetman Champ de la Couronne. Toujours dans la même année, il épouse Marie Casimire Louise de La Grange d'Arquien. Devenu commandant respectée après sa grande victoire en polonais - Cosaques - Tartare de guerre, il a atteint le plus haut rang dans l'armée polonais-lituanien, Grand Hetman de la Couronne, et est ainsi devenu le commandant en chef de l'armée polonaise . [PARAGRAPH: 1] Au cours de la guerre polonais - ottomane, les Turcs Sobieski défaite dans la bataille de Chocim. Actualités de cette réalisation, réparties dans l'ensemble du pays, faisant de Sobieski personnalité la plus populaire depuis Michal I, Roi de Pologne avaient trouvé la mort. Le 19 mai de l'année suivante, il a été élu le nouveau monarque du Commonwealth. Jean Sobieski a été couronné Jean III, le 2 février 1676. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski maintenant faire face aux rigueurs de la relance de la guerre a dévasté la Pologne. Sobieski présenté un traité de paix avec les Turcs à mettre un terme à la guerre dans le sud. En 1674, Sobieski appelé à la guerre contre les Turcs et ont réussi à capturer plusieurs forteresses, actuellement en train de créer une forte frontière sud de la Pologne en Ukraine. En 1675, les Tatars tenté de reprendre la ville stratégique de Zorawno, mais en vain. Ainsi, un traité de paix a été signé peu de temps après. Avec la signature de traités de paix, l'accent a été transformé de la guerre à la réparation du pays et le renforcement de l'autorité royale. Bien que constamment souligné auprès de l'Autriche et de Brandebourg, le polonais Sobieski réforme militaire. Le militaire a été réorganisée, l'infanterie de piques remplacés par des haches de guerre, et l'adoption de la cavalerie polonaise formations de hussards et dragons. Sobieski également augmenté le nombre de fusils et mis au point de nouvelles tactiques de l'artillerie. [PARAGRAPH: 1] À l'heure actuelle, Sobieski tenté à plusieurs reprises de renforcer la Pologne contre ses ennemis. À la fin, il a décidé de s'allier avec Léopold Ier du Saint-Empire. Il a également rejoint la Sainte Ligue initiée par le pape Innocent XI de préserver la chrétienté. L'alliance, bien que dirigée contre les Turcs, avait l'avantage d'avoir le soutien pour la défense des frontières méridionales de la Pologne. Après avoir découvert des espions polonais turc préparation d'une campagne militaire, Sobieski fortifié les villes de Lwow et Cracovie, dont il craignait étaient les cibles des campagnes turques. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski Une des plus grandes réussites a été, lors de la victoire à la bataille de Vienne, est entré dans le commandement de polonais, autrichien, et les troupes allemandes. Ensemble, ils ont lutté contre les envahisseurs turcs sous Mustapha Kara. Il a dirigé une attaque de 81.000 hommes contre 130.000 Turcs, qui étaient partagés entre l'attaque de la ville et de la lutte contre l'armée unifiée. Sobieski plus tard conduit hussarde quatre groupes de cavalerie dans une redevance sur la colline. Bientôt, la bataille ligne turc a été rompu et de la bataille de Vienne clos. [PARAGRAPH: 1] roi Jean III Sobieski est décédé à Wilanow, de la Pologne le 17 juin 1696. Lui et son épouse, qui est mort en 1716 en France, sont enterrés ensemble dans la cathédrale de Wawel à Cracovie, Pologne. Il a été remplacé par Auguste II, dont la mort aboutir à une lutte pour la couronne de Pologne, connu sous le nom de la guerre de Succession de Pologne.
TEXT.German: [H1]Johann III Sobieski[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]König von Polen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Angeordnet:[\BOLD] 1629 - 1696[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Geboren im 1629 in der kleinen Stadt Olesko, John III Sobieski war Mitglied einer bemerkenswerten Adelsfamilie Sobieszyn Sobieski der Clan Janina. Nach Sobieski absolvierte Nowodworski College in Krakau, er sein Studium an der philosophischen Fakultät der Jagiellonen-Universität. Nach Abschluss seines Studiums, John reiste mit Bruder ist Marek Sobieski durch Westeuropa. Während dieser Zeit hat er gelernt, Französisch und Italienisch, zusätzlich zu Latein. Wissen, diese Sprachen würde sich ein wichtiger Aktivposten in seinen späteren militärische Karriere. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Nach seiner Rückkehr nach Polen in 1648, John Sobieski freiwillig für die Armee während des Chmielnicki Aufstands und gründete seine eigene Fahne der Kavallerie, Kommandeur es in den Rang eines Rotamaster. John kämpfte mit Auszeichnung in der Schlacht von Beresteczko viel, so dass König Johann II. Kasimir schickte ihn zu dem Osmanischen Reich als ein Gesandter. Dort lernte Sobieski der tatarischen Sprache und studierte das türkische Militär Traditionen und Taktik. Während der schwedischen Invasion Polens, John Sobieski war ein Mitglied der Greater polnischen Regimenter der Leitung von Krzysztof Opalinski, Palatine von Poznan, Vereidigung Allianz für die schwedische König. Allerdings, John wieder auf der polnischen Seite und kämpfte für den König. [PARAGRAPH: 1] John III Sobieski brillant befehligte ein Regiment von Tataren Kavallerie in der drei Tage langen Schlacht von Warschau in diesem Jahr. Nach seinem Erfolg wurde er auf den Titel Lord Standard - Inhaberaktien der Krone. Seine militärische Karriere profitierte auch während der Lubomirski Rebellion, wo Sobieski blieb loyal zum König. In 1655 wurde er zum Rang eines Grand Marshal der Krone und später in den Rang eines Field Hetman der Krone. Auch in diesem Jahr heiratete er Marie Casimire Louise en la Grange d'Arquien. Nachdem sich ein geachteter Kommandeur nach seiner großen Siege in der polnischen - Kosaken - Tatarisch Krieges, erreichte er den höchsten militärischen Rang in der polnisch-litauischen Commonwealth, Grand Hetman der Krone, und so wurde der Kommandant in der Oberbefehlshaber der polnischen Armee . [PARAGRAPH: 1] In der polnischen Osmanischen Krieg, Sobieski besiegte die Türken in der Schlacht von Chocim. Nachrichten von diesem Erfolg auf der ganzen Land, wodurch Sobieski die beliebteste Persönlichkeit seit Michal I., König von Polen gestorben war. Am 19. Mai des folgenden Jahres wurde er zum neuen König des Commonwealth. John Sobieski wurde gekrönt Johannes III am 2. Februar 1676. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski nun die Nöte der Wiederbelebung der vom Krieg verwüsteten Polen - Litauen. Sobieski einen Friedensvertrag mit den Osmanen zu beenden den Krieg im Süden des Landes. In 1674, Sobieski fordert für den Krieg gegen die Türken und verwaltet werden, um mehrere Festungen, die jetzt zur Gründung einer starken südlichen Grenze für Polen in der Ukraine. In 1675, die Tataren versucht zu wiederholen, die strategische Stadt Zorawno, doch blieben erfolglos. So wird ein Friedensvertrag unterzeichnet wurde bald nach. Mit der Unterzeichnung der Friedensverträge, gefasst wurde vom Krieg zum Wiederaufbau des Landes und die Stärkung der königlichen Autorität. Obwohl stets betont, mit Österreich und Brandenburg, Sobieski Reform des polnischen Militärs. Das Militär wurde reorganisiert, die Infanterie Hechte ersetzt Schlacht Achsen, und polnische Kavallerie über die Verabschiedung der Formationen der Husaren und Dragoner. Sobieski auch die Zahl der Waffen und entwickelten neue Taktik für die Artillerie. [PARAGRAPH: 1] In dieser Zeit, Sobieski mehrere Versuche zur Stärkung der Polen gegen ihre Feinde. Am Ende entschied er sich zu verbünden sich mit Leopold I., Kaiser des Heiligen Römischen Reiches. Er trat auch der Heilige Liga, die von Papst Innozenz XI zur Erhaltung des Christentums. Die Allianz, obwohl die gegen die Türken, hatte den Vorteil, der sich für die Verteidigung der südlichen Grenzen Polens. Nach polnischen Spione aufgedeckt türkischen Vorbereitungen für eine militärische Kampagne, die Sobieski befestigten Städten Lemberg und Krakau, die er befürchtete, wurden die Ziele der türkischen Kampagnen. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Einer der größten Erfolge Sobieski wurde bei der Erringung des Sieges in der Schlacht von Wien, in den verbundenen Befehl der polnischen, österreichischen und deutschen Truppen. Gemeinsam kämpften sie Invasion der Türken unter Kara Mustafa. Er führte ein Angriff von 81.000 Männern gegen 130.000 Türken, die zwischen dem Angriff auf die Stadt und die Bekämpfung des vereinten Armee. Sobieski später führte vier Husaren Kavallerie Gruppen eine Gebühr in die Hügel. Bestellt, die türkische Schlacht wurde gebrochen und der Schlacht von Wien beendet. [PARAGRAPH: 1] König Johann III Sobieski starb in Wilanow, Polen am 17. Juni 1696. Er und seine Frau, die starb 1716 in Frankreich, begraben gemeinsam im Dom Wawel in Krakau, Polen. Er wurde von Augustus II, dessen Tosssd führen zu einem Kampf um die Krone von Polen, bekannt als der Krieg von der polnischen Erbfolgekrieg.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Giovanni III Sobieski[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Re di Polonia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Regolato:[\BOLD] 1629 - 1696[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Nato nel 1629 nel piccolo comune di Olesko, Giovanni III Sobieski è stato il membro di una notevole nobile di Sobieszyn Sobieski famiglia di Clan Janina. Dopo Sobieski laureato da Nowodworski College di Cracovia, si è laureato alla Facoltà di filosofia dell'Università di Jagellonica. Dopo aver completato i suoi studi, viaggiò con Giovanni è fratello di Marek Sobieski attraverso l'Europa occidentale. Durante questo tempo, ha imparato francese tedesco e italiano, oltre al latino. La conoscenza di queste lingue sarebbe rivelata un importante patrimonio nella sua successiva carriera militare. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Dopo il ritorno in Polonia, nel 1648, Giovanni Sobieski volontari per l'esercito durante la Chmielnicki Uprising e fondato il suo vessillo di cavalleria, a comandare in grado di Rotamaster. Giovanni combattuto con distinzione nella Battaglia di Beresteczko molto in modo che il Re Giovanni II Casimiro lo inviò a ottomano come un emissario. Esiste, Sobieski imparato la lingua e tartaro studiato il turco tradizioni militari e tattiche. Durante l'invasione svedese di Polonia, Giovanni Sobieski è stato membro della Greater polacco reggimenti piombo da Krzysztof Opalinski, Palatine di Poznan, giurare alleanza per il re svedese. Tuttavia, Giovanni restituiti al polacco lato e lottato per il re. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Giovanni III Sobieski brillantemente comandato un reggimento di cavalleria Tataro nella tre giorni di lunga battaglia di Varsavia, che anno. Dopo il suo successo, è stato promosso per il titolo Signore - Standard portatore della Corona. La sua carriera militare anche beneficiato durante il Lubomirski Ribellione, dove Sobieski rimasta fedele al Re. Nel 1655 è stato promosso al rango di Grand Marshal della Corona e, successivamente, al rango di Campo Hetman della Corona. Inoltre, in tale anno, sposò Marie Casimire Luisa de la Grange d'Arquien. Dopo diventando un comandante rispettato dopo la sua grande vittorie in polacco - cosacco - Tataro guerra, ha raggiunto il più alto grado militare nella Polacco-Lituano, Grand Hetman della Corona, e quindi è diventato il comandante in capo dell 'esercito polacco . [PARAGRAPH: 1] Durante la guerra polacca - ottomano, Sobieski sconfitto i turchi nella battaglia di Chocim. Notizie di questo risultato diffusione in tutto il paese, rendendo più popolari Sobieski personalità dal Michal I, re di Polonia era morto. Il 19 maggio dell'anno successivo, è stato eletto il nuovo monarca del Commonwealth. Giovanni Sobieski è stato coronato Giovanni III il 2 febbraio 1676. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski ora di fronte alla difficoltà di ravvivare la guerra - devastato Polonia - Lituania. Sobieski introdotto un trattato di pace con gli ottomani, a cessare la guerra nel sud. Nel 1674, Sobieski chiamato per la guerra contro i turchi e sono riusciti a catturare numerose fortezze, ora che istituisce un forte frontiera meridionale per la Polonia in Ucraina. Nel 1675, i tartari tentato di riconquistare la strategica comune di Zorawno, ma non hanno avuto successo. Così, un trattato di pace è stato firmato subito dopo. Con la firma dei trattati di pace, focus è stato trasformato dalla guerra per il risarcimento del paese e di rafforzare il potere reale. Sebbene costantemente sottolineato con l'Austria e Brandeburgo, Sobieski riforma militare polacco. Il militare è stata riorganizzata, fanteria's pikes sostituito con assi di battaglia, e la cavalleria polacca adottando la formazioni di ussari e dragoons. Sobieski anche aumentato il numero delle armi e sviluppato nuove tattiche per artiglieria. [PARAGRAPH: 1] In questo momento, Sobieski fatto diversi tentativi di rafforzare la Polonia contro i suoi nemici. Alla fine, ha deciso di allearsi con se stesso Leopoldo I, Imperatore del Sacro Romano Impero. Ha aderito anche la Santa Lega avviato da Papa Innocenzo XI per preservare la cristianità. L'alleanza, anche se indirizzata contro i Turchi, ha avuto il vantaggio di un maggior sostegno per la difesa dei confini meridionali della Polonia. Dopo aver scoperto spie polacco turco preparativi per una campagna militare, Sobieski fortificato le città di Lwow e Cracovia, che egli teme che sono stati gli obiettivi del Turco campagne. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski Uno dei più grandi successi è stata la vittoria nella battaglia di Vienna, nella parte del comando polacco, austriaco, e le truppe tedesche. Insieme, hanno combattuto invasori turchi sotto Kara Mustafa. Egli ha portato a pieno attacco di 81.000 uomini contro 130.000 turchi, che sono stati ripartiti tra le attacco del comune e di lotta contro l'esercito unito. Sobieski successivamente portato ussaro cavalleria quattro gruppi in una tassa sulla collina. Presto, il turco era rotto linea di battaglia e la battaglia di Vienna si è concluso. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Re Giovanni III Sobieski morto in Wilanow, Polonia, il 17 giugno 1696. Lui e la moglie, che morì nel 1716 in Francia, sono sepolti insieme nella cattedrale del Wawel a Cracovia, in Polonia. Egli era riuscito da Augusto II, la cui morte condurre a una lotta per la corona di Polonia, conosciuto come la guerra di successione polacca.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Juan III Sobieski[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rey de Polonia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gobernado:[\BOLD] 1629 - 1696[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Nacido en 1629 en la pequeña ciudad de Olesko, Juan III Sobieski fue el miembro de una notable familia noble de Sobieszyn Sobieski Clan de Janina. Después de Sobieski se graduó de Nowodworski universidad de Cracovia, se graduó de la facultad de filosofía de la Universidad Jagellónica. Después de completar sus estudios, viajó con Juan es hermano Marek Sobieski a través de Europa occidental. Durante ese tiempo, él aprendió francés alemán e italiano, además del latín. Sabiendo estas lenguas sería demostrado ser un activo importante en su posterior carrera militar. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Después de regresar a Polonia en 1648, John Sobieski ofreció voluntariamente para el ejército durante la Chmielnicki Uprising y fundó su propia bandera de la caballería, al mando de ella en el rango de Rotamaster. John luchó con distinción en la Batalla de Beresteczko es así que el rey Juan II le envió a Casimir el Imperio Otomano como un emisario. Allí, Sobieski aprendido la lengua tártara y estudió las tradiciones militares turcos y las tácticas. Sin embargo, John regresó al lado polaco y luchó por el rey. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Juan III Sobieski brillantemente al mando de un regimiento de caballería en el tártaro de tres días de duración larga batalla de Varsovia ese año. Después de su éxito, fue promovido al título Lord Estándar - Portador de la Corona. Su carrera militar también se benefició durante la Rebelión Lubomirski, donde Sobieski permanecieron leales al rey. En 1655, fue promovido al rango de Gran Mariscal de la Corona y más tarde al rango de Hetman sobre el terreno de la Corona. También en ese año, se casó con Marie Casimire Luisa de la Grange de Arquien. Después de convertirse en un respetado comandante después de su gran victoria en el polaco - Cosacos - tártaro Guerra, que logró el más alto rango militar en la Comunidad de Polonia y Lituania, el Gran Hetman de la Corona, y, por tanto, se convirtió en el comandante en jefe del Ejército polaco . [PARAGRAPH: 1] Durante la Guerra polaco - otomano, Sobieski derrotó a los turcos en la batalla de Chocim. Noticias de este logro repartidos por todo el país, haciendo Sobieski la personalidad más popular desde Michal I, Rey de Polonia había muerto. El 19 de mayo del año siguiente, fue elegido como el nuevo monarca de la Comunidad. John John Sobieski III fue coronado el 2 de febrero de 1676. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski ahora enfrenta las dificultades de la guerra, la reactivación de la devastada Polonia - Lituania. Sobieski presentó un tratado de paz con los otomanos a poner fin a la guerra en el sur. En 1674, Sobieski llamado en favor de la guerra contra los turcos y lograron capturar varias fortalezas, ahora se establece una fuerte frontera meridional de Polonia en Ucrania. En 1675, los tártaros intentó retomar la ciudad estratégica de Zorawno, pero no tuvieron éxito. Por lo tanto, un tratado de paz se firmó poco después. Con la firma de los tratados de paz, se centra de la guerra a la reparación del país y el fortalecimiento de la autoridad real. Aunque subrayó constantemente con Austria y Brandeburgo, Sobieski reformado el militar polaco. Los militares se reorganizó, de la infantería de lucios reemplazado con hachas de batalla, la caballería polaca y la adopción de las formaciones de hussars y dragones. Sobieski también aumentó el número de cañones y desarrollado nuevas tácticas de la artillería. [PARAGRAPH: 1] En este momento, Sobieski hecho varios intentos de fortalecer Polonia contra sus enemigos. Al final, él decidió aliarse con Leopoldo I, rey de España. También se unió a la Liga Santa, iniciado por el Papa Inocencio XI de preservar la cristiandad. La alianza, aunque dirigidas contra los turcos, tuvo la ventaja de obtener apoyo para la defensa de la frontera meridional de Polonia. Después de espías polacos descubrieron los preparativos de Turquía para una campaña militar, Sobieski fortificada de las ciudades de Lwow y Cracovia, que temía que fueron el blanco de campañas de los turcos. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Sobieski Uno de los mayores éxitos fue en la victoria en la Batalla de Viena, se unió en el mando de polaco, austriaco, y las tropas alemanas. Juntos, ellos combatieron a los invasores turcos en virtud de Kara Mustafa. Dirigió un ataque de 81.000 hombres contra 130.000 turcos, que se dividieron entre el ataque de la ciudad y de la lucha contra el ejército unido. Sobieski más tarde la causa de que cuatro hussar caballería grupos en un cargo por la ladera. Pronto, la línea de batalla de Turquía tras la ruptura de la Batalla de Viena terminado. [PARAGRAPH: 1] El rey Juan III Sobieski murió en Wilanow, de Polonia el 17 de junio de 1696. Él y su esposa, que falleció en 1716 en Francia, están enterrados juntos en la catedral del Wawel en Cracovia, Polonia. Fue sucedido por Augusto II, cuya muerte conducir a una lucha por la corona de Polonia, conocida como la Guerra de Sucesión de Polonia.

TEXT.English: [H1]Solomon[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Israel[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived: [\BOLD]c.1000 - 928 BC[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The time of the reigns of David and Solomon was a golden age for Israel. David's military skill relieved Israel of its constant war threats from surrounding nations, and Solomon's diplomatic skill maintained this empire without the need for further war. Solomon was productive in art and science. He wrote the Song of Solomon, Ecclesiastes, and most of the Book of Proverbs, three books found in the Bible. Early in Solomon's reign, God promised him great wisdom. [PARAGRAPH:1] When King David was aging, he lost his mental sharpness. His oldest son, Adonijah, attempted to seize the throne from Solomon. Despite the fact that God had promised Solomon the throne, David, in his declining mental health, did nothing to stop Adonijah and his preparations. Eventually, the case was brought to the attention of David by Solomon's supporters. David immediately made Solomon king, and retired. Normally, Solomon would kill Adonijah. However, in an attempt to spare his life, Adonijah stole the altar of God and refused to give it back until Solomon promised to spare his life. [PARAGRAPH:1] Solomon is described as surrounding himself with luxuries because of the government's success. Solomon established an alliance with Hiram I, king of Tyre, who helped to give Solomon the supplies he needed for the construction of the Temple. Hiram, and an architect also named Hiram, also helped Solomon complete the construction of the Ark of the Covenant. [PARAGRAPH:1] Solomon built many houses, palaces, gardens, parks, irrigations, and public works. The most famous of his achievements is his construction of the Temple. Because David was unable to build the temple, he accumulated materials for future use. Solomon imported more supplies later. The amount was so great that, to transport the materials, Solomon conscripted a labor force of nearly 200,000 of his own people, not counting the workers of the foreign exporters. Solomon preached sermons and worshipped at the temple. He also prayed to God to be present at the temple. God spoke to Solomon again, and said that if his people were unfaithful, he would destroy them. Even so, if they confessed and repented, he would bless them again. [PARAGRAPH:1] After the completion of the temple, Solomon built many other buildings of importance in Jerusalem. For thirteen years, he was engaged in building the royal palace on Ophel. Solomon is also described to rebuild major cities elsewhere in Israel. Solomon is also attributed to supplying Israel with chariots and horsemen. Solomon's reign in Israel also resulted in great trade and riches with other countries. Solomon's fame spread to wide that it reached the Queen of Sheba, who immediately went to Jerusalem with a caravan full of gifts. Once she arrived, she was very impressed at his immense wealth. [PARAGRAPH:1] Though Solomon remained devout to God for most of his early life, his late was different. Solomon married 1,000 wives, some of which were foreign. God forbade this for fear their religious practices would corrupt the true worship of God. This is in fact what happened to Solomon. Solomon, out of love for his wives, builds idols for them. Building idols was a very bad sin in the eyes of God. Because Solomon went against God's laws, he cursed Solomon's heir, Rehoboam who lost most of the kingdom.
